Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I'll take him from here.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: It's all right. We're going to get you inside.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I kept calling. No one came.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Don't worry. I won't leave you. I promise.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You've been so brave, sweetheart.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Why are you here? All of you?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: We never left, dear.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Does it hurt? Dying?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Quicker than falling asleep.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: And he will want it to be quick.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You're nearly there, son.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I'm sorry. I didn't want any of you to die for me. And Remus, your son...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Others will tell him what his mother and father died for. Someday he'll understand...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You'll stay with me?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Until the end.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: He won't be able to see you?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: No. We're here, you see.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Stay close to me.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Always...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: No sign of him, my Lord.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I thought he would come. I was, it seems... mistaken.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You weren't.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Quiet!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Harry Potter. The Boy Who Lived. Come to die. Nagini HISSES behind her protective guard of Death Eaters. Harry's gaze shifts to her when Voldemort raises

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You cannot help.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Harry. You wonderful boy. You brave, brave man. Let us walk.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Sir, this, is this... I mean, forgive me, but you are dead, aren't you, sir?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Oh, yes.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Then... I'm dead too?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Not?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Not.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: But I didn't defend myself. I let him kill me.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: It's true, isn't it, sir? A bit of him lives in me, doesn't it?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Did. It was just destroyed only moments ago by none other than Voldemort himself.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You were the seventh Horcrux, Harry; the Horcrux he never meant to make.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: And you knew this? That's why you were certain I wouldn't die?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Certain? No. Little is certain in this world, Harry. Call it an educated guess.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Professor, is that -- ?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Exactly where are we, sir?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I was going to ask you that. Where would you say that we are?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: It looks like King's Cross station -- only a lot cleaner. And without the trains.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: King's Cross! Is that right? Well, this is, as they say, your party.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Sir, why didn't you just tell me about the Deathly Hallows?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You will have to forgive me, Harry. You see... I didn't trust

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I feared that you would make the same mistake I made, that you would be intoxicated by the power the Hallows promise their possessor. But I crave your pardon, Harry. It's clear to me now, as it should have been all along, that you are the better man.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Sir --

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You are the worthy possessor of the Hallows, Harry, not me. I was fit to own the Elder Wand, because I took it not for gain, but to save others from it. But I took the Stone because I longed to recall someone who has long been at peace and for that I paid with my life.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You wanted to see Ariana again, didn't you, sir?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Yes.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I used the Stone as well, sir, only a little while ago when I entered the Forest. I saw my mum and dad, and Sirius and Lupin...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: True. But ask yourself this: were you calling them? Or were they calling you?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I've got to go back, haven't I?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: That is up to you.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I've got a choice?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Oh yes. We are in King's Cross, you say? I think, should you so decide, you would be able to, let's say, board a train.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: And where would it take me?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: On.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Voldemort's got the Elder Wand.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: True.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: And the snake lives.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Yes.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: And I've nothing to kill it with.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: 'Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.'

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I have always prized my ability to turn a phrase -- words are, in my

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: With all due respect, sir, I think what we need here is a miracle.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I've never put much stock in miracles, Harry. On the other hand, I can attest wholly to the extensive advantages of a related phenomenon.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Which would be, sir?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Luck.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living and, above all, those who live without love.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Sir, my mother's Patronus. It was a doe, wasn't it? Just like Professor Snape's. Curious, don't you think?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Actually, if I think about it... it doesn't seem curious at all.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Professor.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Is this real? Or has this been happening inside my head?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry. But why should that mean that it is not real?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: My lord, let me help you --

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I do not require assistance.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: The boy. Is he dead?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Is he alive? Draco?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Don't despair, Longbottom. I put you in Gryffindor for good reason...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Who's that?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: ... Hagrid's carrying?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Neville, who is that?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: What's going on here, Neville?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Behold, Nagini. Our work is done.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: No... NO!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Stupid girl. You cry for that?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: While your hands ran dark with the blood of mothers and sons, fathers and daughters, brothers and sisters, his were clasped in prayer -- but it was a prayer for one and one only. While you battled courageously, until you could no longer will yourself to stand, he had long since fallen to his knees. While you cursed me until your voices grew ragged, he begged me for mercy in a voice as meek as a child's.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: So do not cry for that. He's not worthy of your tears. And do not despair of his betrayal. You were never in his heart. Not for one single solitary beat.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Liar!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Did you not hear me! Harry Potter is dead! From this day forward, you put your faith in me or suffer the consequences. HARRY POTTER Is

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Now is the time to declare yourself.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Draco...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Draco, don't be stupid --

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Come, Draco.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: He saved your life.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Well done, Draco. Who will be next? Hm? Come now, don't be shy.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Well, I must say, I'd hoped for better. Is this truly the best Hogwarts has to offer?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Who might you be, young man?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Neville Longbottom.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Well, welcome, Neville. I'm sure we can find a place for you in our ranks.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Someone has to do the washing.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Now, now, Bellatrix. Let's not underestimate our young friend. By stepping forward, he lives to see another day...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I'd like to say something.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Very well, Neville. I'm sure we'd all be fascinated to hear what you have to say.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: It doesn't matter that Harry is gone. A troubled MURMUR ripples through the crowd.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: This isn't over.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Potter! Harry turns. Draco's hand whips forward and -- to Harry's shock -- tosses him his wand. Ron GRINS.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Well done, Malfoy!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Confringo!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: The snake! We've got to kill the snake!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Harry! Look out!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Nagini! With me!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Leave her!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I said LEAVE HER!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Nagini

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Die! Die

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Why do you live!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Because I have something worth living for.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Confringo!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Come on, granny, give us your best.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Back off, boys! She's mine!  You will never touch my chiidren again!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Be thankful we only took one. Besides...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Hermione!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Yes!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I don't want you to say anything you wouldn't say if we weren't about to be killed by a giant snake! It'll just ruin it!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: You were right.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: When you told Professor Snape it was failing you. It will always fail you.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: It belongs to me! I killed Snape!

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Together.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: What's the matter with her?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: There's more to me than incense and tea leaves, Mr. Finnegan.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: I told you: it's useless to you.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Not exactly leaving the place better than we found it, are we?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Something my mum used to say.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Why didn't it work for him? The Elder wand.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Because it answers to another.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: When he killed Snape, he thought the wand would become his. But the thing is... it never belonged to Snape.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: But that means...

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: It answers to me.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: What do you reckon we should do with it?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: We?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Well, it wasn't boring, was it?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Together?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Don't forget to give Professor Longbottom our best.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Will there really be thestrals pulling the carriages?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: There's nothing scary about thestrals. They're gentle things. Anyway, you won't be going up to school in the carriages. You/'be going in the boats, remember?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Dad?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Yes?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: What if I'm put in Slytherin?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Albus Severus Potter. You were named after two Headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin. And he was probably the bravest man I ever knew.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: But just say I am --

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Then Slytherin House will have gained a wonderful wizard. But listen, if it means so much to you, you can choose Gryffindor. The Sorting Hat takes your choice into account.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Really?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Really.

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Ready?

Harry Potter.movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
Harry Potter.text: Ready.

Shrek.text: Once upon a time there was a lovely princess. But she had an enchantment upon her of a fearful sort which could only be broken by love's first kiss. She was locked away in a castle guarded by a terrible fire-breathing dragon. Many brave knights had attempted to free her from this dreadful prison, but non prevailed. She waited in the dragon's keep in the highest room of the tallest tower for her true love and true love's first kiss. (laughs) Like that's ever gonna happen. What a load of - (toilet flush) Allstar - by Smashmouth begins to play. Shrek goes about his day. While in a nearby town, the villagers get together to go after the ogre. NIGHT - NEAR SHREK'S HOME
Think it's in there?
All right. Let's get it!
Whoa. Hold on. Do you know what that thing can do to you?
Yeah, it'll grind your bones for it's bread. Shrek sneaks up behind them and laughs.
Yes, well, actually, that would be a giant. Now, ogres, oh they're much worse. They'll make a suit from your freshly peeled skin.
No!
They'll shave your liver. Squeeze the jelly from your eyes! Actually, it's quite good on toast.

Back! Back, beast! Back! I warn ya! Shrek calmly licks his fingers and extinguishes the torch. The men shrink back away from him. Shrek roars very loudly and long and his breath extinguishes all the remaining torches until the men are in the dark.

This is the part where you run away. And stay out! (looks down and picks up a piece of paper. Reads.) "Wanted. Fairy tale creatures."(He sighs and throws the paper over his shoulder.) THE NEXT DAY There is a line of fairy tale creatures. The head of the guard sits at a table paying people for bringing the fairy tale creatur to him. There are cages all around. Some of the people in line are Peter Pan, who is carrying Tinkerbell in a cage, Gipetto who's carrying Pinocchio, and a farmer who is carrying the three little pigs.
All right. This one's full. Take it away! Move it along. Come on! Get up!
Next!
(taking the witch's broom) Give me that! Your flying days are over. (breaks the broom in half)
That's 20 pieces of silver for the witch. Next!
Get up! Come on!
Twenty pieces.
(crying) This cage is too small.
Please, don't turn me in. I'll never be stubborn again. I can change. Please! Give me another chance!
Oh, shut up. (jerks his rope)
Oh!
Next! What have you got?
This little wooden puppet.
I'm not a puppet. I'm a real boy. (his nose grows)
Five shillings for the possessed toy. Take it away.
Father, please! Don't let them do this! Help me! Gipetto takes the money and walks off. The old woman steps up to the table.
Next! What have you got?
Well, I've got a talking donkey.
Right. Well, that's good for ten shillings, if you can prove it.
Oh, go ahead, little fella. Donkey just looks up at her.
Well?
Oh, oh, he's just...he's just a little nervous. He's really quite a chatterbox. Talk, you boneheaded dolt...
That's it. I've heard enough. Guards!
No, no, he talks! He does. (pretends to be Donkey) I can talk. I love to talk. I'm the talkingest damn thing you ever saw.
Get her out of my sight.

No, no! I swear! Oh! He can talk! The guards grab the old woman and she struggles with them. One of her legs flies out and kicks Tinkerbell out of Peter Pan's hands, and her cage drops on Donkey's head. He gets sprinkled with fairy dust and he's able to fly.
Hey! I can fly!
He can fly!
He can fly!
He can talk!

Ha, ha! That's right, fool! Now I'm a flying, talking donkey. You might have seen a housefly, maybe even a superfly but I bet you ain't never seen a donkey fly. Ha, ha! (the pixie dust begins to wear off) Uh-oh. (he begins to sink to the ground.) He hits the ground with a thud.
Seize him! (Donkey takes of running.) After him!

He's getting away! Get him! This way! Turn! Donkey keeps running and he eventually runs into Shrek. Literally Shrek turns around to see who bumped into him. Donkey looks scare for a moment then he spots the guards coming up the path. He quickly hides behind Shrek.
You there. Ogre!
Aye?
By the order of Lord Farquaad I am authorized to place you both under arrest and transport you to a designated resettlement facility.

Oh, really? You and what army? He looks behind the guard and the guard turns to look as well and we see that the other men have run off. The guard tucks tail and runs off. Shrek laughs and goes back about his business and begins walking back to his cottage.
Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!
Are you talkin' to...(he turns around and Donkey is gone) me? (he turns back around and Donkey is right in front of him.) Whoa!

Yes. I was talkin' to you. Can I tell you that you that you was great back here? Those guards! They thought they was all of that. Then you showed up, and bam! They was trippin' over themselves like babes in the woods. That really made me feel good to see that.
Oh, that's great. Really.
Man, it's good to be free.
Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?

But, uh, I don't have any friends. And I'm not goin' out there by myself. Hey, wait a minute! I got a great idea! I'll stick with you. You're mean, green, fightin' machine. Together we'll scare the spit out of anybody that crosses us. Shrek turns and regards Donkey for a moment before roaring very loudly.

Oh, wow! That was really scary. If you don't mind me sayin', if that don't work, your breath certainly will get the job done, 'cause you definitely need some Tic Tacs or something, 'cause you breath stinks! You almost burned the hair outta my nose, just like the time...(Shrek covers his mouth but Donkey continues to talk, so Shrek removes his hand.) ...then I ate some rotten berries. I had strong gases leaking out of my butt that day.
Why are you following me?
I'll tell you why. (singing) 'Cause I'm all alone, There's no one here beside me, My problems have all gone, There's no one to deride me, But you gotta have faith...
Stop singing! It's no wonder you don't have any friends.
Wow. Only a true friend would be that cruelly honest.
Listen, little donkey. Take a look at me. What am I?
(looks all the way up at Shrek) Uh ...really tall?
No! I'm an ogre! You know. "Grab your torch and pitchforks." Doesn't that bother you?
Nope.
Really?
Really, really.
Oh.
Man, I like you. What's you name?
Uh, Shrek.

Shrek? Well, you know what I like about you, Shrek? You got that kind of I-don't-care-what-nobo thing. I like that. I respect that, Shrek. You all right. (They come over a hill and you can see Shrek's cottage.) Whoa! Look at that. Who'd want to live in place like that?
That would be my home.

Oh! And it is lovely! Just beautiful. You know you are quite a decorator. It's amazing what you've done with such a modest budget. I like that boulder. That is a nice boulder. I guess you don't entertain much, do you?
I like my privacy.

You know, I do too. That's another thing we have in common. Like I hate it when you got somebody in your face. You've trying to give them a hint, and they won't leave. There's that awkward silence. (awkward silence) Can I stay with you?
Uh, what?
Can I stay with you, please?
(sarcastically) Of course!
Really?
No.

Please! I don't wanna go back there! You don't know what it's like to be considered a freak. (pause while he looks at Shrek) Well, maybe you do. But that's why we gotta stick together. You gotta let me stay! Please! Please!
Okay! Okay! But one night only.
Ah! Thank you! (he runs inside the cottage)
What are you...? (Donkey hops up onto a chair.) No! No!
This is gonna be fun! We can stay up late, swappin' manly stories, and in the mornin' I'm makin' waffles.
Oh!
Where do, uh, I sleep?
(irritated) Outside!

Oh, well, I guess that's cool. I mean, I don't know you, and you don't know me, so I guess outside is best, you know. Here I go. Good night. (Shrek slams the door.) (sigh) I mean, I do like the outdoors. I'm a donkey. I was born outside. I'll just be sitting by myself outside, I guess, you know. By myself, outside. I'm all alone...there's no one here beside me...

Once upon a time in a kingdom far, far away, the king and queen were blessed with a beautiful baby girl. And throughout the land, everyone was happy... until the sun went down and they saw that their daughter was cursed with a frightful enchantment that took hold each and every night. Desperate, they sought the help of a fairy godmother who had them lock the young princess away in a tower, there to await the kiss... of the handsome Prince Charming.
What?
Princess... Fiona?
No!
She's on her honeymoon.
Honeymoon? With whom?
It's so good to be home! Just you and me and...
Donkey?
Shrek! Fiona! Aren't you two a sight for sore eyes! Give us a hug, Shrek, you old love machine. And look at you, Mrs. Shrek. How 'bout a side of sugar for the steed?
Donkey, what are you doing here?
Taking care of your love nest for you.
Oh, you mean like... sorting the mail and watering the plants?
Yeah, and feeding the fish!
I don't have any fish.
You did.
Don't you want to tell me about your trip? Or how about a game of Parcheesi?
Actually, Donkey? Shouldn't you be getting home to Dragon?
Oh, yeah, that. I don't know. She's been all moody and stuff lately. I thought I'd move in with you.
You know we're always happy to see you, Donkey.
But Fiona and I are married now. We need a little time, you know, to be together. Just with each other. Alone.
Say no more. You don't have to worry about a thing. I will always be here to make sure nobody bothers you.
Donkey!
Yes, roomie?
You're bothering me.
Oh, OK. All right, cool. I guess... Me and Pinocchio was going to catch a tournament, anyway, so...Maybe I'll see y'all Sunday for a barbecue or something.
He'll be fine. Now, where were we?
Mom and Dad?
Prince Charming?
Royal ball? Can I come?
We're not going.
What?
I mean, don't you think they might be a bit...shocked to see you like this?
Well, they might be a bit surprised. But they're my parents, Shrek. They love me. And don't worry. They'll love you, too.
Yeah, right. Somehow I don't think I'll be welcome at the country club.
Stop it. They're not like that.
How do you explain Sergeant Pompous and the Fancy Pants Club Band?
Oh, come on! You could at least give them a chance.
To do what? Sharpen their pitchforks?
No! They just want to give you their blessing.
Oh, great. Now I need their blessing?
If you want to be a part of this family, yes!
Who says I want to be part of this family?
You did! When you married me!
Well, there's some fine print for you!
Trust me. It's a bad idea. We are not going! And that's final!
Hey, wait for me.

Hit it! Move 'em on! Head 'em up! Head 'em up, move 'em on! Head 'em up! Move ‘em on, Rawhide! Knock 'em out! Pound 'em dead! Make 'em tea! Buy 'em drinks! Meet their mamas! Milk 'em hard! Rawhide! Yeehaw!
Are we there yet?
No.
Are we there yet?
Not yet.
OK, are we there yet?
No.
Are we there yet?
No!
Are we there yet?
Yes.
Really?
No!
Are we there yet?
Are we there yet?
That's not funny. That's really immature.
That's not funny. That's really immature.
This is why nobody likes ogres.
This is why nobody likes ogres.
Your loss!
Your loss!
I'm gonna just stop talking.
Finally!
This is taking forever, Shrek. There's no in-flight movie or nothing!
The Kingdom of Far, Far Away, Donkey. That's where we're going. Far, far --
All right, all right, I get it. I'm just so darn bored.
Oh, finally!
Announcing the long-awaited return of the beautiful Princess Fiona and her new husband.
Well, this is it.
This is it.
This is it.
Of course! Look. Mom and Dad look happy to see us.
Who on earth are they?
I think that's our little girl.
That's not little! That's a really big problem. Wasn't she supposed to kiss Prince Charming and break the spell?
Happy now? We came. We saw them. Now let's go before they light the torches.
They're my parents.
Hello? They locked you in a tower.
That was for my own...
Good! Here's our chance. Let's go back inside and pretend we're not home.
Harold, we have to be...
Quick! While they're not looking we can make a run for it.
Shrek, stop it! Everything's gonna be...
A disaster! There is no way...
You can do this.
I really...
Really...
don't...
want...
be...
Here!
Mom... Dad...I'd like you to meet my husband... Shrek.
Well, um...It's easy to see where Fiona gets her good looks from.

Shrek.character: DONKEY ENTERS SHAKING OFF A GUARD

Shrek.text: No! No! Bad donkey! Bad! Go!
No, Dad! It's all right. It's all right. He's with us. He helped rescue me from the dragon.
That's me: the noble steed.
Oh, boy.
So, Fiona, tell us about where you live.
Well...Shrek owns his own land. Don't you, honey?
An ogre from a swamp. Oh! How original.
I suppose that would be a fine place to raise the children.
It's a bit early to be thinking about that, isn't it?
Indeed.
Harold!
What's that supposed to mean?
Dad. It's great, OK?
For his type, yes.
My type?
I suppose any grandchildren I could expect from you would be...
Ogres, yes!
Not that there's anything wrong with that. Right, Harold?
Dad!
No, we usually prefer the ones who've been locked away in a tower!
Shrek, please!
I only did that because I love her.
Aye, day care or dragon-guarded castle.
You wouldn't understand. You're not her father!
Harold!
Shrek!
Fiona!
Fiona!
Mom!
Harold...
Donkey!
Oh, my dear. Oh, look at you. You're all grown up.
Who are you?
Oh, sweet pea! I'm your fairy godmother.
I have a fairy godmother?

Shush, shush. Now, don't worry. I'm here to make it all better. With just a wave of my magic wand, your troubles will soon be gone. For example, how about a sporty carriage to ride in style, with a sexy man- boy chauffeur named Kyle?
Thank you very much, Fairy Godmother, but...
Fiona? Fiona.
Oh, uh...Fairy Godmother... I'd like you to meet my husband, Shrek.
Your husband? What? What did you say? When did this happen?
Shrek is the one who rescued me.
But that can't be right.
Oh, great, more relatives!
She's just trying to help.
Good! She can help us pack. Get your coat, dear. We're leaving.
What? I don't want to leave. When did you decide this?
Shortly after arriving.
Look, I'm sorry...
No, that's all right. I need to go, anyway. But remember, dear. If you should ever need me... happiness...is just a teardrop away.
Thanks, but we've got all the happiness we need. Happy, happy, happy...
So I see. Let's go, Kyle.
Very nice, Shrek.
What? I told you coming here was a bad idea.
You could've at least tried to get along with my father.
I don't think I was going to get Daddy's blessing, even if I did want it.
Do you think it might be nice if somebody asked me what I wanted?
Sure. Do you want me to pack for you?
You're unbelievable! You're behaving like a...
Go on! Say it!
Like an ogre!
Here's a news flash for you! Whether your parents like it or not...I am an ogre! And guess what, Princess? That's not about to change.
I've made changes for you, Shrek. Think about that.
That's real smooth, Shrek. "I'm an ogre!"
I knew this would happen.
You should. You started it.
I can hardly believe that, Lillian. He's the ogre. Not me.
I think, Harold, you're taking this a little too personally. This is Fiona's choice.
But she was supposed to choose the prince we picked for her. I mean, you expect me to give my blessings to this... thing?
they were in bloom...
Our first kiss.
It's not the same! I don't think you realize that our daughter has married a monster!
Oh, stop being such a drama king.
Fine! Pretend there's nothing wrong! La, di, da, di, da! Isn't it all wonderful! I'd like to know how it could get any worse!
What happened?
Nothing, dear! Just the old crusade wound playing up a bit! I'll just stretch it out here for a while.
We need to talk.
Actually, Fairy Godmother, off to bed.
You remember my son, Prince Charming?
Is that you? My gosh! It's been years. When did you get back?
Oh, about five minutes ago, actually. After I endured blistering winds, scorching desert...I climbed to the highest room in the tallest tower...

Mommy can handle this. He endures blistering winds and scorching desert! He climbs to the highest bloody room of the tallest bloody tower...And what does he find? Some gender-confused wolf telling him that his princess is already married.
It wasn't my fault. He didn't get there in time.
Harold.
My diet is ruined! Yes, I’d like two Renaissance Wraps, no mayo... chili rings...
I'll have the Medieval Meal.
One Medieval Meal and, Harold... Curly fries?
No, thank you.
Sourdough soft taco, then?
No, really, I'm fine.
Nothing else thanks.
So, Fiona and Charming will be together.
Yes.
Believe me, Harold. It's what's best. Not only for your daughter...but for your Kingdom.
What am I supposed to do about it?
Use your imagination.
Ah! There you are. Right. You see, I need to have someone taken care of.
Who's the guy?
Well, he's not a guy, per se. Um... He's an ogre.
Hey, buddy, let me clue you in. There's only one fellow who can handle a job like that, and, frankly...he don't like to be disturbed.
Where could I find him?
Hello?
Who dares speak to me?
Sorry! I hope I'm not interrupting, but I'm told you're the one to talk to about an ogre problem?
You are told correct. But for this, I charge a great deal of money.
Would... this be enough?
You have engaged my valuable services, Your Majesty. Just tell me where I can find this ogre.

Dear Diary... Sleeping Beauty is having a slumber party tomorrow, but Dad says I can't go. He never lets me out after sunset. Dad says I'm going away for a while. Must be like some finishing school. Mom says that when I'm old enough, my Prince Charming will rescue me from my tower and bring me back to my family, and we'll all live happily ever after. Mrs. Fiona Charming. Mrs. Fiona Charming. Mrs. Fiona Charming.
Sorry. I hope I'm not interrupting anything.
No, no. I was just reading a, uh... a scary book.
I was hoping you'd let me apologize for my despicable behavior earlier.
Okay...
I don't know what came over me. Do you suppose we could pretend it never happened and start over...
Look, Your Majesty, I just...
Please. Call me Dad.
Dad. We both acted like ogres. Maybe we just need some time to get to know each other.
Sure.
Face it, Donkey! We're lost.
We can't be lost. We followed the King's instructions exactly. "Head to the darkest part of the woods...""Past the sinister trees with scary-looking branches." The bush shaped like Shirley Bassey!
We passed that three times already!
You were the one who said not to stop for directions.
Oh, great. My one chance to fix things up with Fiona's dad and I end up lost in the woods with you!
Don't get huffy! I'm only trying to help.
I know! I know. I'm sorry, all right?
Hey, don't worry about it.
I just really need to make things work with this guy.
Well, well, well, Donkey. I know it was kind of a tender moment back there, but the purring?
What? I ain't purring.
Sure. What's next? A hug?
Hey, Shrek. Donkeys don't purr. What do you think I am, some kind of a...
Ha-ha! Fear me, if you dare!
Look! A little cat.
Look out, Shrek! He got a piece!
It's a cat, Donkey. Come here, little kitty, kitty. Come on, little kitty. Come here.
Now, ye ogre, pray for mercy from...Puss... in Boots!
I'll kill that cat!
Ah-ha-ha!
Oh! That is nasty!
What should we do with him?
Take the sword and neuter him.

Oh, no! Por favor! Please! I implore you! It was nothing personal, Señor. I was doing it only for my family. My mother, she is sick. And my father lives off the garbage! The King offered me much in gold and I have a litter of brothers...
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Fiona's father paid you to do this?
The rich King? Sí.
Well, so much for Dad's royal blessing.
Don't feel bad. Almost everybody that meets you wants to kill you.
Maybe Fiona would've been better off if I were some sort of Prince Charming.
That's what the King said. Oh, uh... sorry. I thought that question was directed at me.
Shrek, Fiona knows you'd do anything for her.

Well, it's not like I wouldn't change if I could. I just... I just wish I could make her happy. Hold the phone... "Happiness. Just a tear drop away." Donkey! Think of the saddest thing that's ever happened to you!
No, Donkey! I need you to cry!
Don't go projecting on me. I know you're feeling bad, but you got to
Fairy Godmother is away from desk or with a client. But I can help you with your ‘Happiness problems’
Kyle, I’ve been looking everywhere for you! Why aren’t you
Well, um, it seems that Fiona's not exactly happy.

Oh-ho-ho! And there's some question as to why that is? Well, let's explore that, shall we? Cinderella."Lived happily ever after." No ogres! Snow White. A handsome prince. Oh, no ogres. Sleeping Beauty. No ogres! Hansel and Gretel? No! Thumbelina? No. the Little Mermaid, Pretty Woman...No, no, no! You see, ogres don't live happily ever after.
All right, look, lady!
Don't you point...those dirty green sausages at me!
Ah... that's okay. We’ll go. Very sorry to have wasted your time, Miss Godmother.
I need a Monte Cristo Sandwich now. You’ve got me all worked up.
Shrek, are you off your nut?
Donkey, quiet and keep watch.
Keep watch? Yeah, I'll keep watch. I'll watch that wicked witch come and whammy a world of hurt up your backside. I'll laugh, too. I'll be giggling to myself.
Toad Stool Softener? Elfa Seltzer? Hex Lax?
Help me find "handsome."
Hey! How about "Happily Ever After"?
Well, what does it do?
It says "Beauty Divine."
What happened here? Kyle! Clean this up.
Mother!
This isn't a good time, pumpkin. Mama's working.
Whoa, what happened here?
The ogre, that's what!
What? Where is he, Mom? I shall rend his head from his shoulders! I will smite him where he stands! He will rue the very day he stole my kingdom from me!
Oh, put it away, Junior! You're still going to be king. We'll just have to come up with something smarter.
Pardon. Um...Everything is accounted for, Fairy Godmother, except for one potion.
What?
Try to at least pretend you're interested in your daughter's wedding ball.
Honestly, Lillian, I don't think it matters. How do we know there will even be a ball?
Mom. Dad.
Oh, hello, dear. What's that, Cedric? Right! Coming.
Mom, have you seen Shrek?
I haven't. You should ask your father. Be sure and use small words, dear. He's a little slow this morning.
Can I help you, Your Majesty?
Ah, yes! Um...Mmm! Exquisite. What do you call this dish?
That would be the dog's breakfast, Your Majesty.
Ah, yes. Very good, then. Carry on, Cedric.
Dad? Dad, have you seen Shrek?
No, I haven't, dear. I'm sure he just went off to look for a nice... mud hole to cool down in. You know, after your little spat last night.
Oh. You heard that, huh?
The whole kingdom heard you. I mean, after all, it is in his nature to be…well, a bit of a brute.
Well, what did you expect? Look at what he's done to you.
Shrek loves me for who I am. I would think you'd be happy for me.
Darling, I'm just thinking about what's best for you. Maybe you should do the same.
Hey, man, this don't feel right. My donkey senses are tingling all over. Drop that jug o' voodoo and let's get out of here.
It says, "Beauty Divine." How bad can it be?
See, you're allergic to that stuff. You'll have a reaction. And if you think that I'll be smearing Vapor Rub over your chest, think again!
Well, here's to us, Fiona.
Shrek? You drink that, there's no going back.
I know.
No more wallowing in the mud?
I know.
No more itchy butt crack?
I know!
But you love being an ogre!
I know! But I love Fiona more.
Shrek, no! Wait!
I think you grabbed the "Farty Ever After" potion.
Maybe it's a dud.
Or maybe Fiona and I were never meant to be.
Shrek!
There you are! We missed you at dinner. What is it, darling?
Ah! Excellent! That's my girl.
It was a mistake to bring Shrek here. I'm going to go out and find him. And then we'll go back to the swamp where we belong.
Fiona, please! Let's not be rash, darling. You can't go anywhere right now.
Fiona!
Good morning, sleepyhead. I love your kitty!
Oh... My head...
Here, I fetched a pail of water.
Thanks. Uhh!
Gorgeous!
Um... Shrek.
Shrek? Wow. Are you from Europe?
You're tense. I want to rub your shoulders.
Have you seen my donkey?
Wow! That's some quality potion, Shrek! What's in that stuff?
"Warning: Side effects may include burning, itching, oozing, weeping. Not intended for heart patients or those with... nervous disorders."
What?
Señor? "To make the effects of this potion permanent, the drinker must obtain his true love's kiss by midnight."
Midnight?
Why is it always midnight?
Pick me! I'll be your true love!
Look, lady, I already have a true love.
Oh...
Take it from me, Boss. You are going to have one satisfied Princess.
And let's face it. Even though you are a lot easier on the eyes, inside you're the same old mean, salty...
...cantankerous, foul, angry ogre you always been.
And you're still the same annoying donkey.
Well...Look out, Princess. Here comes the new me.
First things first. We need to get you out of those clothes.
Halt!
Tell Princess Fiona her husband, Sir Shrek, is here to see her.
Fiona!
Shrek?
Fiona?
Hello, handsome.
Shrek!
Princess!
Donkey?
Wow! That potion worked on you, too?
What potion?
Shrek took some magic potion. And well...Now, he’s sexy!
For you, baby... I could be.
Yeah, you wish.
Donkey, where is Shrek?
He went inside looking for you.
Shrek?
Fiona! Fiona!
Fiona?
Shrek?
Aye, Fiona. It is me. What happened to your voice?
The potion changed a lot of things, Fiona. But not the way I feel about you.
Fiona?
Charming?
Um... Who are you?
Mom, it's me, Shrek. I know you never get a second chance at a first impression, but, well, what do you think?
Fiona! Fiona!
Fiona, Fiona! Ho-ho-ho! Oh, shoot! I don't think they can hear us, pigeon.
I just wanted her to be happy.
And now she can be. Oh, sweetheart. She's finally found the prince of her dreams.
But look at me. Look what I've done for her.
It's time you stop living in a fairy tale, Shrek. She's a princess, and you're an ogre. That's something no amount of potion will ever change.
But...I love her.
If you really love her... you'll let her go.
Here you go, boys.
Just leave the bottle, Doris.
Hey. Why the long face?
It was all just a stupid mistake. I never should have rescued her from that tower in the first place.
I hate Mondays.
I can't believe you'd walk away from the best thing that happened to you.
What choice do I have? She loves that pretty boy, Prince Charming.
Come on. Is he really that good- looking?
Are you kidding? He's gorgeous! He has a face that looks like it was
Oh. He sounds dreamy.
You know...shockingly, this isn't making me feel any better. Look, guys. It's for the best. Mom and Dad approve, and Fiona gets the man she's always dreamed of. Everybody wins.
Except for you. I don't get it, Shrek. You love Fiona.
Aye. And that's why I have to let her go.
Excuse me, is she here?
She's, uh... in the back.
Oh, hello again. Fairy Godmother. Charming.
You'd better have a good reason for dragging us down here, Harold.
Well, I'm afraid Fiona isn't really... warming up to Prince Charming.
FYI, not my fault.
No, of course it's not, dear.
I mean, how charming can I be when I have to pretend I'm that dreadful ogre?
What?
You can't force someone to fall in love!
I beg to differ. I do it all the time!
Umm... no.
What did you say?
I can't. I won't do it.
Oh, yes, you will. If you remember, I helped you with your happily ever after. And I can take it away just as easily. Is that what you want? Is it?
No.
Good boy. Now, we have to go. I need to do Charming's hair before the ball. He's hopeless. He's all high in the front. He can never get to the back. You need someone to do the back.
Oh. Thank you, Mother.
Mother?
Darling? Ah. I thought I might find you here. How about a nice hot cup of tea before the ball?
I'm not going.
The whole Kingdom's turned out to celebrate your marriage.
There's just one problem. That's not my husband. I mean, look at him.
Yes, he is a bit different, but people change for the ones they love. You'd be surprised how much I changed for your mother.
Change? He's completely lost his mind!
Why not come down to the ball and give him another chance? You might find you like this new Shrek.
But it's the old one I fell in love with, Dad. I'd give anything to have him back.
Darling. That's mine. Decaf. Otherwise I'm up all night.

I got to get out of here! I got to get out of here! You can't lock us up like this! Let me go! What about my Miranda rights? You're supposed to say I have the right to remain silent. Nobody said I have the right to remain silent!
You HAVE the right to remain silent. What you lack is capacity.
I must hold on before I, too, go totally mad.
Shrek? Donkey?
Too late.
Gingy! Pinocchio! Get us out of here!
Quick! Tell a lie!
What should I say?
Anything, but quick!
Say something crazy like, "I'm wearing LADIES' UNDERWEAR!"
I am wearing ladies' underwear.
Are you?
It looks like you most certainly am are!
I am not!
What kind?
Oww! They're briefs!
Are not.
Are too!
Here we go. Hang tight.
Okay boys! We've got to stop that kiss!
I thought you was going to let her go.
I was, but I can't let them do this to Fiona.
Boom! That's what I like to hear. Look who's coming around!
It's impossible! You'll never get in. The castle's guarded. There's a moat and everything!
Folks, it looks like we're up chocolate creek without a Popsicle stick.
Don’t worry guys, I have a plan. To the castle!
Ladies and gentlemen. Presenting Princess Fiona and her new husband, Prince Shrek.
Shrek, what are you doing?
I'm just playing the part, Fiona.
Is that glitter on your lips?
Mm. Cherry flavored. Want to taste?
Ugh! What is with you?
But, Muffin Cake...
Fiona, my Princess. Will you honor me with a dance?
Since when do you dance?
Fiona, my dearest, if there's one thing I know, it's that love is full of surprises.
All right, fellas! Let's crash this party!
Halt right there!
Make me!
Not the gumdrop button!
Go! Go! Your lady needs you! Go!
Today, I repay my debt.
Stop! Hey, you! Back away from my wife.
Shrek?
You couldn't just go back to your swamp and leave well enough alone.
Pinocchio! Get the wand!
I'm a real boy!
I'm a real boy. Aah! Oh.
That's mine!
Pray for mercy, from Puss...
and Donkey!
She's taken the potion! Kiss her now!
No!
Fiona.
Shrek.
Harold! You were supposed to give her the potion!
Well, I guess I gave her the wrong tea.
Mommy?
I told you. Ogres don't live happily ever after.
Oh, Dad!
Is he...?
Yup. He croaked.
Harold?
Dad?
I'd hoped you'd never see me like this.
And he gave you a hard time!
Donkey!

No, no, he's right. I'm sorry. To both of you. I only wanted what was best for Fiona. But I can see now... she already has it. Shrek, Fiona... Will you accept an old frog's apologies... and my blessing?
Harold?
I'm sorry, Lillian. I just wish I could be the man you deserve.
You're more that man today than you ever were... warts and all.
Boss! The Happily Ever After Potion!
Midnight! Fiona. Is this what you want? To be this way forever?
What?
Because if you kiss me now... we can stay like this.
You'd do that? For me?
Yes.
I want what any princess wants. To live happily ever after,
Whatever happens, I must not cry! You cannot make me cry!
Now, where were we? Oh. I remember.
Peter Seaman, Jeffrey Price, Chris Miller & Aron Warner
Onward Chauncey, to the highest room of the tallest tower! Where my princess awaits rescue from her handsome Prince Charming.
This is worse than Love Letters! I hate dinner theatre.
Me too.
Whoa there, Chauncey!
Hark! The brave Prince Charming approach-ith. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 2.
Fear not fair maiden! I shall slay the monster that guards you and take my place as rightful King.
What did she say?
Grrrrrrr!
Yea! Shrek!
Prepare foul beast to enter into a world of pain with which you are not familiar!
Do you mind?
Do you mind? Bo-ring! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 3.
Someday you'll be sorry.
We already are!
Grrrrrrr! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 4.
Oh, you're right. I can't let this happen. I can't.
I am the rightful King of Far Far Away and I promise you this mother. I will restore dignity to my throne! PRINCE CHARMING (CONT'D) And this time, no one will stand in my way!
Good morning.
Good morning.
"To you!"
Oh, they grow up so fast.
Not fast enough.
Okay. You have a very full day filling in for the King and Queen. There are several functions that require your attendance, sir. Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 6.
Great! Let's get started.
C'mon, lazy bones, time to get movin'!
Aaahhh! You know you really need to get yourself a pair of jammies.
I knight thee...
He-he. Ooh.
Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 7.
Well, since you're filling in for one, you might as well look like a real King. Can somebody come in here and work on Shrek please?
Ow! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 8.
Oh!
Yeah, wow.
Uh, is this really necessary?
I'm Shrek, you twit.
Whatever.
Okay peoples! This isn't a rehearsal. Let's see some hustle.
Smiles everyone, smiles! Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 9.
I don't know how much longer I can keep this up Fiona.
I'm sorry Shrek, but can you please just try to grin and bear it? It's just until Dad gets better.
Shrek?
Yeah.
You look handsome.
Ah. Come here, you.
Oh, my butt is itching up a storm and I can't reach it in this monkey suit!
Oh.
What's your name? Shrek the Third - Final Screening Script 10.
Eh, Fiddlesworth, sir.
Hoo hoo hooo. Perfect. MASTER OF CEREMONIES Ladies and gentlemen, Princess Fiona and Sir Shrek!
You've done it. Oh, a little over to the left, yeah. That's great.
Uh Shrek?
Ahh! All right, you got it...Oh yeah, you're on it. Oh that's it! Oh that's good!
Shrek...
Oh yeah! Scratch that thing! You got it. You're on it. That's great!

Ron gets up disappears into the men's bathroom. Comes back, right away, clean shaven and in an immaculate suit.
Good evening, I'm Ron Burgundy.
If I'm going to do this I'll need a little help. He yells with cupped hands a mighty battle cry.

He then produces a conch shell which blows sending out an echoing tone. FLASH TO: STOCK FOOTAGE; a marlin taking a hook and leaping in the air. It is Brian, Champ and Brick on a boat in suits with three stewardesses in uniform . MUSIC: The Ventures
Whoah! I got a big one! And I aint talking about the fish!
You guys are fun! They all laugh heartily and then the conch can be heard. They go quiet. Beat.
That's Ron. He needs us.
We can't. We could lose our jobs.
Screw it. There's always radio. Brian powers the boat off. • • 90. I knew you'd come.
Wouldn't have missed it for the world Papa.
News Team!! The van tears off towards the mountains. The link is almost ready. Then we can break into the network broadcast whenever we want.
Oh man, the pigs are gonna piss their pants when this goes down. Alicia looks scared. Hello gentlemen! Everything's ready for you. • •
Thank you Jess Moondragon. Maybe you should put some pants on. I'm good. dangerous brave Ron
Now rememb~r, this is terrain. Be smart and be Burgundy.
How the hell are we gonna get up there?

I've taken care of that. 91. We see four ATVs near the dirt road. Somehow the ATVs have their names on their license plates and are color-coordinated to match the suits of the Action Team. May God be with you Action News Team!

WE SEE A MONTAGE OF THEIR JOURNEY 1) They rock climb up a steep cliff 2) They fly across a cravass holding onto hand grips attached to a wire. 3) They battle white water rapids in an inflatable raft. 4) They fight off a bear with torches 5) They emerge from thick brush. Brick is now wearing a bear skin over his back and the group has gnarled walking sticks. They are back at the van.
By the ghost of Eli Whitney!
We went in a big circle! Jess Moondragon is their sun tanning . • •

I was going to say something. The compound is just over the hill there. Alright fellas. This is just like in Nam back in 64'. I'm taking the point. Don't make a move til I give the go ahead. SERIES OF SHOTS: Showing the team mobilizing. 1) Ron giving hand signals, whistles and hoots. 92. When in Rome! A gun cocks next to his head. It's Deedra X.
If it isn't whitey Mc-whitey-ington. Paul Danover is drinking from a boda bag with Sandra hanging all over him.
Hello Ron Burgundy. Your tie is off center.
Oh, that is embarrassing- •• • 93.
Ron checks his tie and a foot smacks him in the face knocking him out. Ron, what are you doing here?
I came for you Alicia ... my little chinchila.
Ron, there's something you have to know. That dirty trick with the teleprompter. That wasn't-
Oh my God. Alicia, You didn't do it! It was The Alarm Clock wasn't it? I should have known you would never do such a thing .
No Ron. I did it. But it wasn't me. It was a different Alicia. An ugly and ambitious person who I didn't like very much. I want you to know if we get out of here I'm resigning.
The hell you are! ... The only reason you did what you did was because I stole your story and messed everything up. I was a prideful jackass.

Listen Ron. I ran background checks on the whole group before they kidnapped me and they're a wannabe radicals.Which means they're more dangerous because they"ve got something to prove. The CIA's been tracking them for months.
My God ... look how impressive you are. • • •
Doing background checks, checking with the CIA. How did you think of all that?
I just made some calls and did some research. That's what journalists do.
(a revelation} So that's what journalists do! 94. Paul walks toward them with the Muscular Guy and the Deedra X weilding guns.

It's show time! Here's what's going to happen Ms. Corningstone. We're going to interupt the regular news and then the most trusted anchor in town is going to read our manifesto to the world. He tosses some copy onto Alicia .
The hell I will!
Then we kill you.
Go ahead. I'm a news anchor. I'd rather die than lose my credibility ..
I'll do it! Any word from the police?
Nothing. They're scouring the whole mountainside .
They better find em soon. These weekend anchors are awful. • ., 95. So, uh, anyone with information on the missing Action News Team should call ... Where's the friggin phone number?
They can call me. I get very lonely.
Dammit, where's the number? I'm sick of this shit?! Get em off the airl
Who are we gonna go with?
I don't care. Grab some interns! How soon til we broadcast?
Any minute now.
May I ask a question? I'm reading through this copy and I'm not exactly sure what it is you folks are against.
We wanna stop the bullshit.
• .! Beat
And what "bullshit" specificaly are you refering to?
I've been meaning to ask you that too Paul.
Uhhh, you know, bullshit. The Man. Squares. The Government.
What kind of government do you want?
Uh, you know. One run by the people or officials chosen by the people.
That's a democracy. That's what we have!
Come on Paul! I dropped out of massage school to join you! What are we trying to do?!
Yeah! ... Come on! ... Read It!!

You want the manifesto?! Fine here it is. Here's the way The Alarm Clock will change the world forever ... Um ... you know how when we drink beer or soda and then we just throw out the bottles and cans? Well what if everyone started saving those bottles and cans so we could, you know, reuse them?
You are a madman.
Ten months of living in the woods and that's all you came up with?! You've been wastin our time turkey! 96. • •
Yeah, you'd have to have a whole nother garbage can for the bottles! People'll never do that!
Wait, you didn't let me get to the part about electric cars so we don't have to be dependent on foreign oil!
Electric cars? Are you high?!
I can't believe this! ... I was gonna get my Masters before I joined you! ... Savin cans! That's like science fiction!? As they bicker Ron gives an attack signal.

Now Action News Team! Now! MUSIC: ACTIONIFIED VERSION OF THE ACTION NEWS THEME 97. l)Suddenly two legs from above drop down around the Muscular Guy's neck and twist. It is Brick hanging from the ceiling. 2) Brian pops out of the fireplace and lays viscious karate kicks to Deedra X's face. 4)Ron leg sweeps Paul Danover ending with a blow to the chest knocking the wind out of him. S)Champ comes bursting through a window and forward rolls into a punch that takes out Oliver.
Gar-bonzo! Everyone stops and looks at Champ.
It's a new phrase I'm working on, instead of Whammy.
Stick with Whammy ... yeah I like Whammy better ... etc. ... we understand the authorities believe the group is planning to in some way disrupt television broadcasts in the state of Oregon.
Rashard, this is typical of these fringe radical groups. According to Dr. Jason Hartley of UCLA medical school they are motivated by mania and a need for large scale public approval.
Maybe we should make them paid interns. We've got to notify the authorities. Don"t worry little girl, we"ll get you home to your parents.
My parents are dicks! You tricked us with your witchy anchor speak Ron Burgundy! The revolution will be televised! Good work team!
Ron! That camera's on! We've got dead air! • • •
If there's one thing I hate it's dead air. He turns toward the camera.
Be careful Ron! There's no teleprompter!
I don't need a teleprompter to speak from my heart. 99. FLASH TO: SHOTS OF ALL OF PORTLAND LOOKING AT A BLANK SET ON THE TV. A BARTENDER CHANGES THE CHANNELS.
It's on all four channels! Ed Harken and Garth are in the control room.
Ed, there's nothing I can do. They broke into the microwave transmission . Ron slides into the chair and addresses camera.
sweet Jesus. He's got no script. Uh ... um ... hi. ..
Ron you can do it. It's jazz baby. Jazz. The scoring goes from tense into jazz flute.

It's jazz ... It's jazz! I'm terribly sorry Portland, for the interruption. These misguided youths have attempted to take over the airwaves. But if there's one thing Ron Burgundy knows it's that that is not how we do things in the ol' US of A. You see gang. I'm a dreamer. And not just because I sleep eleven hours a night.

I happen to believe that back in 1876 when George Washington came over on the Mayflower he had a dream. And we all take part in that dream not by doing what we want, but through the process of voting. As an anchor I'm not allowed to vote, or to be more precise, I don't know how to vote. But I do know that freedom is free. Quick flash to different viewers riveted to the TV.
These crazies wanted us to wake up. Well I'm awake now. I'm awake to the fact that I love this nutty little land we call America and I love you Ms. Alicia Corningstone. Alicia comes on camera.

Ron, there are literally thousands of men I should be with instead, but I love you too. 100. They kiss. Quick cuts of everyone in Portland watching on TV and applauding. Then the kiss starts getting a little more passionate and then kind of sexual. Everyone gets uncomfortable. We see the Skeevey Guy alone in his apartment.
Oh yeah ... Then a groggy Paul Danover wakes up, wiping the blood from his mouth. He raises his arm and points a GUN at Alicia.
The clock ... has struck .. twelve! He fires the gun at Alicia. And Ron moving with surprising speed leans in and takes the bullet in the shoulder.
Ron!
Spider Man's balls this hurts! Champ subdues Paul .
You ... took a bullet for me. • .,
I would not do that again!! I care for you deeply but it was not worth it!! This hurts like a bitchy bitch!!!
Bur-gun-dy! Bur-gun-dy! Reporters and cameras press in on Ron. NETWORK REPORTER, 42, puts a mic in Ron's face.
Mr. Burgundy, Terry Teagle, I'm with the network. We're doing a "when the newsman becomes the news" angle. How'd you like to report your own story? He hands Ron the microphone.
The network huh? Well why should I do it when you have the best damn reporter in the country right here. Burgundy hands the mic to Alicia.
Ron you should do this. It's your dream.
No. You're the better journalist. Now get to it. He gives her a swat on the butt. Alicia takes her moment and seizes it. She is instantly commanding and articulate.
I'm Alicia Corningstone reporting for channel six, Action News.
Today could have been a very dark day if not for the quick thinking of one brave man .... 102. Fireworks expode in the dusky sky. Frank Vitchard approaches Ron.
Ron Burgundy ... I don't like you. But dammit. I respect you. They clasp hands like gladiators.
So how bout an interview Ron?
Sorry Frank. No comment. Ron strolls off as a dog runs up to Ron and jumps into his arms.
Baxter! I knew you were still alive! It's clearly not Baxter. It's a doberman or a collie.
Hey Ron! That's not-
Shhh. Let him have it.

Yeah, Burgundy had rolled with the punches of change pretty good. He had finally become more than a haircut and a voice. He was truly an anchor­ man. Alicia of course went straight to network. And Ron and Alicia kept up an amazing long distance relationship: six days of work and one day of love making at the hotel by the airport. But after awhile Ron just grew restless anchoring the news. He was no longer satisfied to report on life. He wanted to live it.

So Ron quit the business and took to the road like some kind of wandering gypsy poet. He let America flow over him like hot butter over a fresh boiled lobster. Groovin and digging on the heart beat of existence.

103. A Montage of Burgundy's travels and adventures through this great land of ours: -Ron's hitchhiking by a highway. -Someone is getting an elaborate tatoo of a wizard on their back. Pan up to reveal Ron is the tatoo artist now with a beard. -Ron is skate boarding with a bunch of skaters in an empty pool. -We pan down from Alf on the set of Alf to find it is Ron's hand inside. -Ron naked and running with stallions in slow motion. We pull back to see Jess Moondragon is also with him giving him the thumbs up.
He became more myth than man. And all the while Alicia's star continued to rise ...
I 'm Ed Bradley.
I'm Morley Safer.
I'm Alicia Corningstone. Good night Diane.
Good night Alicia.

And then after ten years of wandering, Ron finally found his mission in life. The one thing he was really good at ... loving Alicia. 104. Alicia enters the house and is greeted by three dogs and three children ages 5-12. Ron is at the counter between the kitchen and living room mixing a giant elaborate salad. They rush to each other and hug and kiss.
Hello sweet heart!! How was work?!
It was great honey ... I got the interview with Arafat. They're flying me to Israel tomorow.
Well hey! Gangbusters sweety! I had a big day myself. I finally got the Tivo to work and I paid the gas bill!! Their seven year old son runs up and tugs on Alicia's coat.
Mom, Dad wouldn't let me drink cologne! Ron scoops up his other son who was playing with a fire poker and cleans up a puddle from one of the dogs all in one motion.

Ron became a great House Husband. But when he wasn't busy doing laundry or picking up the kids from voice lessons he found time to finally realize his dream of going national. And he chose the biggest network of them all. And we're rolling Mr.Burgundy ...
Alrighty, here we go ...
The number you have reached has been disconnected. No further information is available. 105. The second he's done he pumps his fist in triumph.

Yes!! I nailed it!! I'm on fire baby!!! What's that basketball player's name? Michael Gordon! I'm like him!! He goes on celebrating while we see Alicia with the children making their way into the studio, giving Ron a thumbs up.
