Karen McCullah Lutz & Kirsten Smith Shooting Draft July 31, 2000 2. 2                                                                  2 As he rises, we RISE WITH HIM, passing toned, waxed, tanned legs in pink Prada pedal pushers and a pair of perky boobs encased in a spaghetti-strap top -- until we finally reveal a magnificent head of long blonde hair and a sweet, beautiful face. This is ELLE WOODS, 21, the Goddess Queen of Delta Gamma. She talks on a pink, fuzzy phone.

I love you, too! Behind her, a "Go USC" banner is pinned to the pink wall. A stack of "Cosmopolitan"s and "Glamour"s teeters on the dresser. The closet overflows with trendy, designer clothes in a predominance of pink.
I'll see you tonight. She hangs up and lets out a squeal of joy, kissing Underdog's head and taking the card out of his mouth. She reads it, touched.

"Elle and Warner forever". Aww... Underdog yips. 2 3   INT. DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY - SAME TIME A Delta Gamma/Sigma Chi barbecue in full swing. Beautiful college students drink beer and mingle, trying to figure out who they're going to sleep with next. The main wall of the living room has been designated as a "Model Wall" of Delta Gamma girls -- ELLE smiles at us from a Hawaiian Tropic ad and a Miss June USC calendar photo. A cover of an Italian Vogue shows a blonde sexpot MARGOT; a USC cheerleader poster displays a hard-bodied non-blonde SERENA in a pom-pom pose. Serena walks up, fending off an admirer.
Jeremy, enough! I am not going to formal with you. Jeremy slinks off as Margot arrives, agitated.
Can someone please tell Rick that he is not the only Sigma Chi with a big penis?
You guys are so sweet! ELLE, a vision of fluffy blondeness, runs down the stairs toward Serena and Margot, holding the card.
But I ' m not positive it's gonna happen to n i g h t --
Helloo...he just had lunch with his grandmother. You know he got "The Rock".
Why else would she have flown in from Newport? It's not like she'd Fed Ex a six carat diamond.
You think?
I can't believe you're getting engaged! ·    .           . The three girls jump up and down, squealing and hugging.
C'mon ·-- you have to help me pick out the perfect outfit. As they head toward the door, Elle spots AMY, a shy girl in a Delta Gamma Pledge sweatshirt, standing alone.
Amy, what's wrong?
I don't really -- know anyone.
That's because you spend too much time in the library. Come with me. I'll meet you outside. As they go, Elle leads Amy over to a group of jovial Sigma Chi brothers.
Bra ndon , Jason, Grant --this is Amy. Why don't you tell her about the time you guys went golfing naked? Elle winks at Amy and.heads off as the guys launch into their story.
It was classic.     Jason hit with wood all day.
And we never ran out of balls -- Amy laughs. Too demure?
I think you should go with red. It's the color of confidence.
Well, I don't want to look like I know what's coming. . .
I don't understand why you're completely disregarding your signature color. She holds up a tiny pink slipdress.
He's proposing! I can't look like I would on any date. This is the date. The night I'll always remember. I want to look special. Bridal . . . but not like I suspect anything.
A SALESWOMAN looks at her cohort.
There ' s nothing I love more than a dumb blonde with daddy's plastic. She grabs a dress off the Clearance Sale rack, ripping off the "HALF PRICE" TAG.
I can't wait to see you wearing The Rock! Elle looks at them, suddenly concerned.
Wh at if -- you know -- it's not the night?
Why else would he be taking you to The Ivy? You've been dating for a year -- it's not like he's trying to impress you.
Elle, you've heard the man pass gas in his sleep. That practically means you're pre-engaged. '" The Saleswoman approaches with the dress, kiss-assy smile on her face.
Did you see this one? We just got it in yesterday. Elle fingers the dress, then the new price tag, looking back at the saleswoman, excited.
Is this a low-viscosity rayon?
Uh, yes -- of course.
With half-loop top-stitching on the hem?
Absolutely. It's one of a kind.
6. CO NT I NU E D: ( 2 )        .         · 4 ^       Elle hands the dress back to her, no longer pretending to be excited.

It's impossible to use a half-loop topstitch on low-viscosity rayon. It would snag the fabric. And you didn't just get this in, because I remember it from the June Vogue a year ago, so if you're trying to sell it to me at full price, you picked the wrong girl. The saleswoman slinks off, embarrassed.
Nice try... Elle shakes her head and turns back to the girls as she slips on her Manolo Blahnik sandals, doing one last mirror check, smoothing down her golden mane.

Girls, this is it. In a few hours, I'll be the future Mrs. Warner Huntington III. 5    EXT, DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - NIGHT An attractive male finger presses the doorbell. 6    INT. DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - FOYER - NIGHT - SAME TIME Amy peeks through the peephole and turns.

He's here! Elle, standing nearby with Margot and Serena and several other DG's, smooths down her dress and takes a deep breath, o pening the door to find -- WARNER HUNTINGTON, III, 21, tall, chiseled and outrageously handsome. He takes her in, a smile spreading across his face.
You're beautiful.
So are you!
.7. 6 She looks up at him, blushing and completely smitten.    They kiss. After a moment,-Warner extracts himself.
You ready? Her face is awash with devotion.
I am so ready.
Warner and Elle are seated at a cozy table on the patio. Elle takes a sip from her freshly poured champagne flute. Nervous and excited.
Here' s to ~ us. Warner is slower to sip his.
The reason I wanted to come here tonight was to discuss our future. Elle is on the edge of her seat.
I ' m fully amenable to that discussion.
I mean, we're having a lot of fun now -- but things are gonna be different when I ' m at Harvard Law school is a completely different world. I need to be serious.
Of course.
My family expects a lot from me. And I expect a lot from me. I .plan on running for office some day.
And I fully support that.
But the thing is, if I ' m gonna be a senator by the time I ' m thirty -- I can't keep dicking around.
I completely agree.
T hat 's why I think it's time for us to-- Elle takes a deep breath, filled with anticipation.
( ot n ig . . · > . ' . c n iu n ) I think we should break up. Elle's champagne glass drops from her hand and CRASHES onto the patio.
What? Elle starts to flush, completely caught off guard.
I ' m sorry, Elle, I just --
You're breaking up with me?! I thought you were proposing.
Proposing?! Elle, If I ' m going to be a politician, I need to marry a Jackie, not a -- Marilyn.
You're breaking up with me because I ' m too -- blonde?
T hat' s not entirely --
Then what? My boobs are too big? WARNER. Elle -- no --· your boobs are fine -- Her tears start.
So when you said you'd always love me, you were just "dicking around"? Warner looks around the restaurant nervously.

I do love you, Elle. I just can't marry you. You have no idea the pressure I ' m under. My family has five generations of senators. My brother is in the top three at Yale Law. He · just got engaged to a Vanderbilt, for crissakes. Elle stares at him aghast, tears streaming down her face, then pushes her chair away from the table and walks out.
It's not like I have a choice, sweetheart He follows her out.
8 Elle teeters down the sidewalk as best she can in her three inch heels, sobbing. Warner pulls up alongside her in his convertible Saab.
C'mon.   Let me take you home.
No.

Elle -- it's twenty miles back to campus. Elle stops, thinks a minute, then gets in, still crying. Catching her poofy little purse in the door. She re-opens i t, yanking the purse back in. Warner pulls out. 9   EXT. DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - USC - NIGHT 9 Warner pulls up in front. It's a starry, romantic night. Everything should be perfect. It's not. Elle sits, still in shock, as tears continue to eke out.
Elle, believe me, I never expected to be doing this, but I think it's the right thing to do.
How can it be the right thing if we're not together? WARNER . I have to think about my future. And what people expect from me.
So you're breaking up with me because you're afraid your family won't like me? Everybody likes me!
East coast people are different.

Just because I ' m not a Vanderbilt, all of a sudden I ' m white trash? I grew up in Bel Air, Warner! Across the street from Aaron Spelling! I think most people would agree that's way better than a Vanderb ilt --
I told you, Elle.       I need someone -- serious.
I ' m seriously in love with you -- Isn't that enough? He looks away.

I ' m sorry. She gets out of the car and drags herself up the stairs to her sorority house. When she's at the top, she turns back to look at him. His perfect cheekbones highlighted by the streetlamp. He meets her eyes, pained, but determined.       Then pulls away, leaving her there. 10   INT. DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - USC - NIGHT 10 Elle walks down the pink and green carpeted hall, dazed and tear-stained. Margot and Serena emerge from the bathroom, post-shower. Getting ready for a night out.

Why are you back so soon? Serena sees Elle's bare hand. SERENA                                   . Did he forget the ring? Elle silently walks into her room.      Serena and Margot follow, worried. 11   INT. ELLE'S DELTA GAMMA ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS 11 Elle slumps down in an inflatable chair, hugging her knees and cowering in a wretched little ball. Underdog stares at her, concerned. Serena and Margot stand in the door.
Elle?
Where's the Rock?
·. .·. We're not engaged.     It's over!
What?!
. He broke up with me! Serena and Margot gasp in horror, rushing to her side.
Is it a Kappa?
It's not a Theta --
No -- it's just -- not me. I ' m canceling the mixer.   We'll blacklist Sigma Chi.
Thank you, Serena, but I don't think it'll do any good.
What happened? Elle starts to lose it again.
I don't know! Everything was normal at first and then he said he needed someone mo r e -- Serious! .
S e r i o u s ? ! Who the hell does he think he i s ? Y o u ' r e the most popu l a r month on the U S C calendar! S h e points to Elle's "Miss June" page, hanging on the wall.
O h , he is so over on this campus.
I just don ' t underst a n d what went wrong --
Maybe it's the grandmother.        Have you e v e r me t he r ? E l l e wipes her face.
Last month on his birthday. And she liked me! She said I looked like Britney Spears. Why would you say that to someone you didn't like? They shrug, mystified.
How could this happen?
I don't know! I don't know anything any more! I just need to be by myself.
Are you sure? Elle nods.    The girls rise, hugging her.
We still love you.      Sisters forever!
Thank you. I love you, too. As they go, Margot looks at Serena.
Oh, God. What if Josh doesn't think I ' m serious enough?    .
Helloo... you let him have anal sex with you.
Helloo... you let him videotape you diddling yourself. ·

You're right. Phew! As the girls go, they shut the door behind them. Elle gets up and grabs a FRAMED PHOTO of Warner, then lies down on her bed, clutching it to her heart. Underdog leaps up and gives her little doggy kisses. 12     EXT. DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - DAY 12 The sun rises on a sad day.     "HOPELESSLY DEVOTED" by Olivia · Newton-John plays.                                           . 13     INT. DELTA GAMMA HOUSE - HALLWAY - DAY 13 Amy knocks on Elle's door.
Elle? ANOTHER SISTER passes.

Didn't you hear? She leads a reluctant Amy down the hall. 14     INT. ELLE'S DELTA GAMMA ROOM - DAY 14 Spread out on the bed are PICTURES of Elle and Warner: The Sigma Chi formal; their Homecoming Queen and King "wave";

14. 14 14 a 60's party; Mardi Gras night; beach weekend at Coronado. Next to the pictures are thirty dried Ecuardorian long- stemmed pink roses, remnants of their one year anniversary. In the center sits Elle, wearing Warner's old oversized Sigma Chi t-shirt, clutching a Gund teddybear. Depressed and looking like hell, she speaks to an unseen confidante.

I just love him so much! I loved him the first moment I saw him. He's beautiful and smart and someone I totally respect. And I did everything I could to make him love me, but it wasn't enough. Now what am I supposed to do? I planned my whole future around him. My life was going to be all about Warner. Now what's it going to be about? She looks up -- waiting. Staring back at her is Underdog -- who sadly has no answers for her. 15   INT. ELLE'S DELTA GAMMA ROOM - DAY 15 Elle remains in bed, Underdog now clutched to her chest, soaps on the TV.
"Oh, darling.     I'll love you forever."
Bullshit! Serena and Margot enter, bearing Jamba Juice.
Honey, stop! You have to leave this room -- it's been a week.
So? + S erena sits down on the edge of the bed, trying to psyche Elle up.
What's the thing that always makes us feel better, no matter what? .
Cunnilingus?
15. 15                                                                  15 Elle lets out a wail, realizing what she'll be missing. Serena shoots Margot a stern look.

No -- the thing after that, 16   INT. UPSCALE MANICURE SHOP - DAY 16 A row of uniformed manicurists and their classy clients. Chattering away. Therapy in full session. Serena sits in front of her regular nail technician.

It was awful. We all thought she'd be the first to walk down the aisle and now she's totally adrift. The nail technician shakes her head in shared girl-power- angst -- looking over at Elle, who sits in the waiting area, shell-shocked, but showered. Elle picks up the only magazine left on the table -- "Town & Country". She wrinkles her nose. An OLD LADY next to her reads "Seventeen". Elle looks at her, begrudging the access to teen beauty tips, and flips through "Town & Country" n oisily until she freezes on-- the Engagement Section. She gasps.
Oh, my God!                    . She looks at a PHOTO of a horse-faced YOUNG WOMAN standing next to a THREE-YEARS-OLDER VERSION OF WARNER. She turns to the old lady next to her.
Do you know who this is? The old lady looks.
No.
It's Warner's older brother!

Ok fine. How about this? The next rainy day, we rent your three, all time favorite movies, make sangria and popcorn, and hold hands. Once again, end of the day, if you have no feelings, I leave.
Well that actually sounds like a lot of fun but no.
Why do you keep saying no?

Here's why. Because the third sentence you said to me was "I love you". You don't even know who I am. You're in love with an idea. And that's off putting and it's not respectful and it's a way to avoid doing real work on yourself.
You don't think I know who you are?
No Brennan! I don't think you do!

You Dr. Denise Breckstein. You're thirty-four years old and you work in suite 211 at the Gorshin Medical Plaza. When you first set-up your office you were really excited about it. But now it seems drab and depressing to you. You're tired of always being the stable one in the relationship.

74. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * BRENNAN (cont'd) You want someone who will leave silly messages on your cell phone, for no reason. Someone who will hide your underwear to make you late for work. At the same time you don't want to have to be embarrassed about your snorting laugh or the fact that you're way, way too ticklish, or that you still love frosted-covered pop tarts. But most importantly you want someone who, for a change, will listen to all that you have to say. Long beat as she just stares at him.
I don't like this. You have to go. This session is over.

Ok I'll leave. And I'm sorry if I made you feel uncomfortable. However, if you're just faking it and secretly you're just really excited about what I said, then I think that would go against everything you talk about in here about expressing yourself. Beat. Then they both kiss furiously.
Oh my God ... You are such a mess ... and you make me so hot ...
I don't even have a checking account and I'm 39!
Ohhh! ! !
I haven't been to the dentist in eight years! ! Denise pulls away.
Stop! These walls are thin. Come to my house tonight. Here's my number. 75. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 76.
You'll have to pick me up. I don't * have a car. *

You're driving me crazy! * She kisses him again. * We pan past houses with elaborate Christmas lights up. It is Christmas time. Occasionally we see a close-up of a smiling lawn reindeer or a waving Santa Clause. It is a very cheery time. The tree looks great Mom. Really tasteful.
Why thank you Dale. And I have to say, except for the time you stole money from my purse, you have been a joy these past few weeks. Brennan comes in eating a roll.
Brennan did you get the message Denise called?
Yup. She's taking me out to dinner for New Year's. * * * * * * * * * * *
Unbelievable.
Brennan's always had lovely girlfriends. I have to say.
So Morn? Dad? Would it be cool if Dale and I were allowed to open one present each, since it is Christmas Eve?
Oh yeah! Can we, please, please, please?
I don't know. Robert what do you think?
I don't give a shit. You're grown men, it's up to you. You can open up every present under the tree if you want!
I think what you're father is trying to say is that you can make your own choices.
So can we open one or not?
It would just be so we would have something to play with tonight and then we would get tired and go to bed. Robert is just staring at them.

I don't think I'm being clear enough. I ... don't ... give ... a ... fuck. You are grown men. You can take all your presents, open them all up, and throw them in the damn sewer. And if you ask me to leave cookies for Santa Claus, I swear I'm gonna punch you in the mouth. 77. * * * * * * * * * * * Dale and Brennan just stare at him.
Go ahead.
Yes! ! ! 78. They run over and tear into two presents like wild animals.
I'm going down to the Cheesecake Factory for a drink.
Robert, it's Christmas Eve. Robert grabs his jacket and leaves.
Oh my God! Hulk hands that make a smashing sound when you punch!!
A 100% rawhide wallet!! How come Dale got the Hulk Hands! That's bullshit! You reek of cheesecake and scotch.
You know tonight down at the Cheesecake Factory is the happiest I've been in months.
Then I feel very sorry for you.
I love you Nancy. But I think we have to face the fact that this isn't working.

Well what are you suggesting? * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Just then their bedroom door bursts open and Brennan stagger in, in their pajamas, clearly sleepwalking.
Oh sweet Jesus!
It's alright, they're sleepwalking. The two guys stand in place, swaying and making odd as they seemingly "stare" at Robert and Nancy. Just they turn around and walk out of the room.

It is definitely disconcerting, but there is nothing you can really do about it. 79. and Dale noises, like that * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Suddenly Brennan comes back with a armful of presents and * tosses them on the bed. *
What the hell?! * He's immediately followed by Dale who also has presents and * tosses them on the bed. *
Remember don't wake them. * The guys keep coming back with presents but they're now just * walking into the room and hurling them. *
Are you sure we can't wake them? *
I'm telling you they could do real * harm to themselves or others if you * attempt to wake them! *
It's just bizarre. *
I know it is. * We now see the front of the Christmas tree being forced * through the bedroom door. *
Jesus the Christmas tree!
Ahhh!
Be quiet! 80. They both carry the Christmas tree into the room and throw it. They pause and have a "conversation"
Amrnbbbrrkkknik. Juhhnnm
Ahhhsbssmmmmmrn!!
Gorphahiffkm! !
No! They storm out, leaving the room littered with debris. Long beat.
I'll put the tree back. So I told him, I don't care if you are A-Rod. This chopper leases for eight grand a day. Now go work on hitting your curve ball. Dude was dumb founded. Robert laughs hard.
That's too good ... too good!

You'll have to pardon my weird wife. 81. Alice leaves quickly. Dale looks at her plate and we see that she has shaped her food to read "Please meet me in the living room my love." Dale quickly messes it up.

What did I do to deserve that? I felt like I was waiting for years.
This has to stop. This is dangerous and frightening. .. and Santa gave me the AbMaster 4000 and one thousand dollars in fresh minted fifty dollar bills.
That's quite a bit of money for a young man like yourself.
Or not a lot of money for a young man like myself, depending on how you look at it. 82. All of the sudden there is rhythmic banging against the wall.

What's that sound? Suddenly the dining room door bursts open. It's Dale and Alice, they are still engaged in intercourse, but Dale is behind Alice and they are still relatively clothed. Alice is slightly hunched over and Dale has his hands on her shoulders. The kids have their backs to this.
-no not against the door! Oh hey!
What are you guys doing?
Alice was trying to move an extra chair into the dining room and her back went out.
Yes my back went out and Dale is trying to help me. *
We don't need an extra chair. There are plenty of chairs.
Mine wasn't comfortable. Ohhh!!! Beat as they stand there.
Anyway what's going on? What are you guys talking about?
Dammit Dale just sit down.
Ok, we'll just put the chair back. The awkwardly inch back out the door. They exit.
We'll be right back.
So Tiffany what did you get for Christmas? The bumping starts again.
I got my navel pierced and lunch with Deborah Norville.
Watch out! Stay away from the door. Dale and Alice push through the door again.
Hey are you all still talking in here?
Alice is your back still bothering you? Because I have some Doan's back pills.
I'm fine, thank you Nancy. We're almost done moving this chair. 83. * * *
I can help you if you want Dale?
No!!!
Ohhh! !
What is wrong with you?!
We're great, I'll be right back. They leave again. We've gotta stop this!!

That was the most fantastic, wonderful thing ever! Here I got you a check for Prestige Entertainment, I got it directly out of Derek's personal account. Everyone at the office is tiptoeing around the subject, so I march right up to the guy and say, "Hey Derek Huff, nice to meet you, what do you want to be called? Colored, negro or black?" He says black, I say, there, done. A week later, I get a letter in the mail saying we're being sued and this black fellow has quit. Now I ask you, what did I do wrong?
That's completely inappropriate Derek.
I don't know Nancy. It is really hard nowadays with all these labels.
Well be that as it may, we have something we'd like to talk about.
Are you going to do this now?
I think we should, everyone's here.
Did you sneak out and get me Hulk hands?
No Brennan, I didn't get you fuckin' Hulk hands!!!!
What's going on?
Nancy and I have been talking. Things have been pretty rough between us, I know we hide it well. We've just come to a decision that at this point in our lives, we can't keep living like this.
What Robert is trying to say is that we're getting a divorce. Everyone just looks at each other. Brennan and Dale both begin to sob.
Don't do this!
You know what, it's what you have to do. Ask Alice, I called this a week ago.
Why!! Why is this happening??
Was it us?! It's our fault! We did this!!
That's the main thing Robert and I talked about. We don't want you two to feel like you're to blame.
What can we do to fix it!?
Dale, honey? Are you alright?
Why are you calling him honey?
I can't stress this enough. It's not your fault!
Ah the hell with this! It is your fault. It's directly your fault! The reason we're breaking up is because of you two dip shits!! Brennan and Dale explode with wailing.
Ahhh ! ! Ohhh ! ! Mommy! ! Daddy! !
Yikes, this is gruesome.

Alright here is what's happening. We're moving out and putting the house up for sale. However long it takes to sell it, that's your time to find an apartment and jobs. I'm moving in with my friend Jack Handle. Nancy found a townhouse in the city. And that's that. 86.
You know Robert, I've got my real estate license, I could sell this place for you at two-thirds commission.
Well that makes it real easy. Thank you Derek. 87. The boys sob as Nancy starts clearing the table and slowly everyone goes to the living room. MUSIC CUE: GREEN DAY "PARADISE"

l)For sale sign being put on the front lawn with a smiling picture of Derek Huff on it. 2) movers come in and move all the furniture out. 3) Nancy hugging Dale and Brennan good-bye, then driving off. 4) Robert hugging Dale and Brennan good bye, then driving off. 5) Chris Gardoki and the weird Redhead ride by on their bikes, Dale and Brennan run into the house. 6) Shots of several rooms that are empty, except for folding lawn chairs. 7) Last shot is their room packed with stuff, in the center is a fort made from a blanket with a flashlight on inside. We push on inside. It's just you and me bro. And then there were two.
I'm so scared Dale. What are we going to do? What are we going to do!!?? *
Shhh. One thing I know for sure is we are not going to leave this house. This is !!lY house! You know what they say in football when a home team defends it's field? "Not in my house!"
So we don't leave this house. We make sure Derek can't sell it?
Exactly.
What about Chris Gardoki and the weird redheaded kid? I don't want to lick white dog crap! I don't want to do it!
That may happen at some point, but right now we gotta strap it down and go into Rambo-ninja-mode! Now say it with me! Not in my house!
Not in my house!
No you put the emphasis on the wrong word. Not in my house!
Not in my house!
Just say the whole thing strong. Not in my house!
I don't think I get it. I mean I get the whole concept of what you're saying, I just can't say the phrase right.
Ok that's fine. So we refuse to leave the house. And then, most importantly, we've got to get mom and dad back together. 88. * *
What do we do for money?
That's taken care of. Dale hands Brennan Alice's crumpled check.
Alice came through for Prestige Entertainment with a check for ten grand.
Holy shit!
So we can use this for food and supplies and other essentials. And to bank roll our master plan.
We're gonna be okay.
Damn right we're going to be okay. Not in my house!
No! Not there! In that place! 89. * As you can see you got a nice big * front lawn, beautiful colonial * entry and great neighborhood. Let * me just get this door open. *
It's beautiful. What do you think * Jim? *

It is really nice. I'm getting a good feeling from this one, Kathy. * * * 90. They enter into the house and find Dale there, cradling * Brennan, wrapped up in a shower curtain, holding himself as * stiff as a board, as if he's a dead body. *
Can't you people give me some privacy!! He just died last night!!
Oh my god!!
We are so sorry They run out of the house. Derek just stands there. Dale and Brennan stand up.
You fuckers just cost me a sale.
That was the whole idea, now wasn't it Derek? Derek turns and stands in the doorway.
I'm going to have to take this up a notch. He closes the door and leaves.

We're going to have to get mom and dad back together fast. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Hold on . .. she's not there yet. . . * We see Nancy through her third story window walk into her * office and sit behind her desk. *
Okay, now! * Dale presses send. Hello, Nancy Huff speaking.
(doing a mild impression of Robert) Hello Nancy. It's Robert.
Hello Robert? This connection is terrible. I can barely hear you. It doesn't matter. Because the real connection I want is between us.
What?
I miss you sweetie. I miss the way you touch me.
Hey! That's my Mother!
(whispering back to Brennan) This is how married couples talk.
Who is this?
It's Robert. And we made a mistake breaking up. I'm so hard right now. Will you stroke my shaft? * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Fucking stop it!
Brennan? Dale hangs up.
You just asked my Mom to stroke your shaft!
Grow the hell up! I'm sure your Mom stroked my Dad's shaft a hundred times.
Nooooo! ! ! Brennan tackles Dale on the street and they fight. 92. Nancy watches from her office window shaking her head sadly.
Shit! She can see us!
Book! They run down the street. Nancy is now on the phone.

They just called me pretending to be you ... I know ... I bet you they haven't even left the house yet ... Oh my God, I'm so glad you came! He gives her a kiss. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Brennan where have you been? You haven't called in a week.
I was scared.
Why were you scared?
Because I think part of the reason you spend time with me is because I'm messed up.
Of course. I've been nothing but up front about that.
Well now I'm taking care of myself. I'm living in my own home and things are going really well. And I guess I thought you wouldn't want to be around me anymore.
Brennan, I want nothing but the best for you. If you're doing well that makes me happy. 93. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
Oh thank God. I was worried I was * doing too well. . . *
Don't worry. Now can I see your * place? I'm excited for you. * Hey! Brennan was right! You are * hot! *
Oh my God ... Brennan lights up a cigarette.
I took up smoking. Doesn't it make me look cool?
Why are there so many empty pizza boxes?
Most of the boxes are full. We just ordered this many so we didn't have to keep calling. Dale walks over, still naked, holding a piece a pizza.
Hey Brennan? I figured it out. We can clean our clothes in the neighbors' pool at night.
Denise this is my stepbrother Dale.
Hey nice to meet you. Look I can put a robe or towel on if you're uncomfortable but if you're fine with it, I'm definitely cool with it.
I should go ... I'm going to leave ... She walks out the front door. Brennan follows.
I am such an idiot ... I'm such a fucking idiot ...

Brennan, someday you're going to take a leap and I'll be very excited to talk to that person that you become. But until that point, I can't see you anymore. I'm sorry. Denise gets into her car and drives off.
Denise! Denise!! Dale comes walking out naked.
Let her go bro.
Maybe we should just leave the house and go get jobs ...
Hey! Hey! We have got to stay focused! Once we get Mom and Dad back together everything will go back to being the way it was.
Really?
Of course. Now say it ...

Not in the house!! 95. If the Doctors are complaining about the size of the sample stands then just leave the samples without the stands. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Her Assistant runs up to her.
Nancy, Francine wants to meet you for dinner tonight at Georgio's to discuss the new Renomax line.
Ahh Francine drives me nuts! We talked for three hours yesterday about that.
I expressed that, Nancy but she wants to meet for dinner.
Okay, fine then.
She's a real bitch, isn't she?
Hey that's not professional.
I'm sorry, I thought we were speaking freely. Is that louder or softer? Sir? Sir? Robert's Receptionist peaks in the door.
Dr. Doback? Am I interrupting?
No I don't think he can hear me at all.
Dr. Kalane called and wants to meet you for dinner tonight. He said it's about you heading the department at the University Hospital. 96.
Really?
I'm sorry to interrupt.
No, you're not interrupting at all, that's huge news. Plus, I think Mr. Devlin is suffering from total hearing loss. The receptionist leaves and Robert turns to the patient.
Hey! Hey! Horse cock! ... I shouldn't do that ... Well you were right Dale. Talking on the phone and doing make believe voices was a lot of fun.
I just don't understand why this Dr. Kalane couldn't call your father himself.
Well he just couldn't and the part is you get pizza to take
Hmrnm fresh pizza.
No it's not Mrs. Lawson.
Shhhh! ! !
best home. It was fun to do funny voices, I think my friend Carol would get a kick out of it. Do you know Carol?
MR. WEEDLE (cont'd) Carol Mongh? She's on the local news.
Oh is she your neighbor?
No, she's on the news. She does the four o'clock and the six o'clock news. I talk to her every night, on the tv.
Oh, well thanks for helping us.
She's wonderful. She's smart, funny, has a real twinkle in her eye. She's a nip. I don't know what the terms are these days. She's from Vietnam.
She's Vietnamese.
No, that doesn't sound right. She's a nip. Anyway, my son Nathan and his family moved to Dallas and she's my best friend. (secretly) I even snuck a kiss in the other night.
So you kissed the television set.
No, I kissed her. On the lips. Oh I've said too much.
I think I'm going to cry.
Well thanks again. Why don't you guys head home.
Last week I fell down in my kitchen and I didn't get up for two days. My cat licked my face and I pretended to be a baby. 98. * * * *
This was a bad idea.
Shut up Brennan. We'll see you guys later, have a nice evening. He ushers them out the door.
Now I feel really sad.

Dude our plan is working! Mom and dad are going to have dinner tonight! Don't go all soft on me. Now let's go wash our clothes in the pool, eat some pizza and take a few cuts in the batting cage to get ready. Hello, Dr. Robert Doback. I'm here for dinner with Dr. Kalane.
Let me check ... She looks at her reservation list and then smiles slyly.
Oh yes, I see it's a very special evening for you.
How do you know that? She leads him through the restaurant towards the back corner. There we find Nancy already seated at the table. * * *
Oh no.
Enjoy your dinner ... The Hostess leaves as Robert stands there awkwardly.
Dale and Brennan.
It had to be. I gotta say I'm impressed.
Well what should we do?
Well I'm actually hungry.
I'm fine with it if you are. Robert sits down.
So how was your day? MONTAGE: MUSIC: ART TATUM PIANO Shots of Robert and Nancy enjoying dinner, laughing, 100. selecting a bottle of wine, having what appears to be a great time.
and it turned out she wasn't pregnant at all but had just had a nasty spider bite.
... Ha, ha, ha ... Brennan and Dale enter the restaurant. Dale is playing guitar and Brennan is singing loudly and carrying a dozen roses.

TONIGHT I CELEBRATE MY LOVE FOR YOU IT SEEMS THE NATURAL THING TO DO
Oh no. They come walking towards Nancy and Robert's table.
TONIGHT NO ONE'S GONNA FIND US WE'LL LEAVE THE WORLD BEHIND US

TONIGHT ROBERT CELEBRATES HIS LOVE
TOGETHER SO THEIR SONS CAN HAVE A
Shut up! You suck!
Okay ... that kind of stung ... Ummm ... I might cry ... I told you I didn't want to sing Dale!
Don't listen to him. You sound great. Keep going! TONIGHT I CELEBRATE MY LOVE FOR YOU
Let's just move to the last part, okay?
Okay. Go! Dale keeps strumming as Brennan takes out some crumpled notebook paper. 101. * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 102.
Mom. I know that you love Robert. * And to remind you, here ' s a page * from your diary. *
Brennan, don't. *

"Today was a tough one. Robert * didn't want to have sex again. But despite this, I still * love him" Do you hear that Robert? * She loves you. *

I'm leaving. * Dale pushes his Dad back down. And then filling around the * table and entering from different points of the restaurant are Nancy's assistant, Robert's receptionist, Alice, Dr. Kalane, Mr. Weedle and Mrs. Lawson.
Do you see how much people want you together? Because ... TONIGHT NANCY AND ROBERT WILL GET BACK TOGETHER ... Songs ends.
All of the people from your life came here tonight just to tell you that they think it's crazy you two aren't together.
Actually I was told there was a medical emergency.
They told me you needed your cell phone charger.
Is Carol Mongh here? *
Well?
Well what?
Are you getting back together?
Absolutely not! That's not how life works. You don't lie to people, read pages from their diary and expect two people to get back together.
I mean holy toledo! Come on guys, if this were in a movie it would be too much. Damn we got really close.
I don't know, Robert was pretty direct about how they felt.

Ok here's my idea for the next plan. We call them up and say we're porno directors for the elderly and we tell them we think they're hot. And if they'll do our movie we pay them $10 million each. They have sex and realize that they're still in love and we're all back together.
That is crazy, dumb and gross. * * *
You know what, you're crazy, dumb and gross. Dale shoves Brennan. Brennan looks up.

Oh no. 104. They look up to see their house with a sheriff's car in front of it, with flashing lights. Two deputies are putting a padlock on the front door. Derek and one of his jackass friends are standing in front of the house smirking.
Well if it isn't Captain Dick licker and his sidekick Sgt. Meat curtain! Guess what? I just put you in lockdown!
You can't do this. That's our house!
No see it's not your house. It's Dr. Robert Dobak's house and the sheriff happens to agree with me. Dale, wake up! Hey!
Ow my back! My whole lower half is asleep.
I'm starving man. How much money do we have left of the Prestige Entertainment/Alice money? *

Let's see, we spent two thousand dollars on pizza, four thousand on the flat screen, two thousand on the batting cage, then a thousand on miscellaneous and then the last thousand I just flat out, lost. I have no idea where it is.
You lost a thousand dollars? How?
Well I got all the money in thousand dollar bills which was really fuckin cool and I think what happened was, I thought it was a single and I tipped the pizza guy with it.
That's why he gave us all those breadsticks. Man, how are we gonna get food?
Is this crazy? Do we eat dog food until we get back on our feet?
You can get through anything with a little bottle of Tabasco. The tree fort begins creaking and moaning.
Uh-oh. 105. We see the entire tree fort fall from the tree to the ground and smash apart leaving Brennan and Dale strewn across the back lawn.
Oooohhhh ... are you alright?
Yeah. I guess ...
I think we should call Mom and Dad. * *
No! Then they'll think we don't know how to take care of ourselves. Listen, I think we can get more money from Alice ... Dale gets us and dusts himself off.
We're kind of lovers.
What?
Do you remember Christmas dinner when we kept trying to bring the chair in?
Yeah.
We were making it happen while we were talking to you.
Holy shit dude! You laid my brother's wife! You laid her!
That's not how you use the word "laid." It's not a verb.
I guess I'm not mad. I just felt like I should be. Truth is Derek cheats on her like crazy.
Alice believes in me. Hell, she believes in us. She may be our only hope. We need your help Alice.
You should have called.
Hi Alice.
Come in. They enter and in the living room sit Derek, Robert and Nancy.
Mom! Dad!
Hello boys.
What are you doing here together?
We were sort of expecting you to show up here after Derek called the Sheriff.
Listen guys ... relationships are tricky.
They are. There's an ebb and flow to the way people feel about each other. Love is a constant but sometimes it can get obscured.
What does that mean?
Are you pregnant Nancy?
Hey fuck sticks! They've been together all along.
Wha? You two were never divorced?
Absolutely not. Nancy is the love of my life. We were trying to create ... what's the word?
Change. Positive change.
Basically we thought that if you two thought we were split up and there was no home, that maybe you'd go out on your own.
But you didn't.
You two hung in there and stood up for what you believed in, like I've never seen. Unfortunately, what you believe in, is not working and living off your parents.
Robert.
I don't say it in judgement. It's just a fact.
Thank you ... It was hard ... etc.
So basically we're moving back into the house.

I've learned to accept that you two are just special. That you will never be full functioning adults. Heck, it could be a lot worse. There are some parents out there who have kids with down syndrome or who are addicted to crystal meth. 108.
Yeah, we're not so bad!
So that's it? We're going to be a family again?
Yes. We're a family again.
Dale it all worked!
I knew it would. 109. They all have some sort of group hug. Alice joins in the hug.
This is beautiful.

We just need you guys to sign some paperwork to make it all official. (yelling off camera) Bradley why don't you come out here! The door to the study opens up and a man in a suit, BRADLEY, 52, enters with a woman behind him, carrying some papers.
This is Bradley Asher, Robert's attorney. Basically you'll be signing some papers that will make you our legal dependents.
How are you boys today? Are you going to ride in a car and get ice cream? Ice cream is yummy!
Bradley! They're not like that!

Oh. My apologies. What we have here is a standard form of dependency. This will give your parents control of your financial assets, power of attorney, also responsibility for all medical care. Basically it's the same kind of form you would see for a child in a vegetative state.
Why do we have to sign this?
It's going to help Nancy and Robert with their taxes and make it easier for them to care for you.
Score! So in other words, we're making out like bandits!
Sure, I guess you are. I've never heard it expressed that way, in fact, most of the time people signing these types of documents can't speak.
Where do I sign?
Just in these fourteen places, starting here. And there. Initial here. Brennan is furiously signing the documents.
Can we slow down here?
Actually the sooner we get these signed, the sooner we can get ice cream!
Yes! I wish I could write with both hands! 110. Dale is watching this with uneasiness. He looks over at Alice who is looking at him.
Done! Get going Dale! Let's go!
I don't think I want to do this.
Why are you being weird? This is it, we won. * *
This feels wrong Brennan.
What are you talking about? This is everything we wanted. We get to live at home. Mom and dad are back together. Come on.
I don't know. It just seems for the first time ... pathetic.
So you're not going to sign this?
No, I don't think I'm going to. Hey Derek, remember a long time ago, in the tree fort, you offered me a job?
Yeah.
I think I want that job.
You know it's a shitty job and I hate you and because I hate you, I'm going to bust your balls everyday?
Yeah, I think that's going to be okay.
What are you doing Dale? We hate Derek.
I think you should take a job too.

I don't know who I'm talking to anymore. All I know is I'm going to get some ice cream with my mom and dad. Later I'll probably light off some fireworks, have some pudding and start drawing pictures of the new tree fort, for the backyard.
111. * * BRENNAN (cont'd) That's the real world Dale!! What you're talking about is crazy land!
It may be, but there's a part of me saying I've gotta do this! I feel alone, terrified and yet at the same time, I've never felt more alive! Alice runs up to Dale and starts kissing him.
My god you're magnificent! I must have you!
Hey! Alice what the fuck?!!

Oh, I'm sorry, it's these diet pills I'm on. l)Shot of hazmat crew cleaning out the house of pizza boxes and trash with Robert, Nancy and Brennan watching on. 2) Dale * * * is with a realtor who is showing him a studio apartment 3) Brennan plays Dale's drums and then slams the sticks down and * walks away 4) Dale sits at a desk in a tiny cubicle, at a giant office, filling out W2 form. Derek walks in, looks at the W2 form, tears it up and makes him fill out another one 5) Brennan puts on eye shadow and paints his pinky finger black. We see that he is going Goth 6) Dale is having a beer with a couple co-workers, they are all laughing, he seems awkward. Then Dale says something, they all laugh, Dale seems to loosen up. 10) Brennan, wearing all goth clothes and make- up, stands on the front lawn. 113. Chris Gardoki and the weird red-head ride by on their bikes. Brennan chases them and they are now afraid of him. I gotta tell you when you set foot in this place we were all laughin' behind your back. Derek even said, "I'm hiring this guy for shits and giggles. He's a freak and he's probably gonna quit after a week." But you've hung in there.
Thanks Randy.
And just the other day, I overheard the bossrnan say, "I gotta give it up, pussyboy turned out to be a half-decent shit shoveler."
It's been a good two months.

Here's what's going on. Derek has decided to throw some actual, real responsibility your way. Little thing called the Catalina wine mixer, it's our marquee event every year. We get all the heavy hitters, I'm talking Raytheon, GE, Northrup, all corning out, looking to be wined and dined, mostly wined, so we can tell them about our leasing options on our helicopters. It's a big deal. It's the fuckin' Catalina wine mixer.
Ok. So what would be my responsibilities Randy? *

We'll first off you gotta make sure there is enough wine and food for sixty to one hundred people. And then there's the music. We got to make sure there is a live musical act that flat out nails it. Let me just give you an idea of what you're up against. Last year we had Donna Abdul, Paula Abdul's mother and she brought it. She brought every bit of it.
Paula Abdul's morn is a singer?
Yes. Do you own a radio? Specifically a ham radio, because that's how she broadcasts her shit?!!
I think I'm getting the idea.

You better be. It's the Catalina wine mixer and it is the big leagues. You're gonna have to have a big ol' pair of hairy, veiny balls to get through this one. 114. Randy just stares at Dale, breathing a little to hard.
Is there a problem Randy?

It's the Catalina wine mixer!!! You nail this or you're gone! Simple as that. I'm gonna be breathing up your ass the whole way. So guess what hombre, if you know a world class singer, now is the time to make that phone call! Would you turn down that music!? Brennan?! Brennan!? Finally Brennan gets up and turns down the music.
What mom!?
What has gotten into you? With the music and the hair and make-up?
Can't you see!? I've gone goth because I feel sad inside!!
Well I'm very sorry that you feel sad inside, but your stepbrother Dale is on the phone and he would like to talk to you. She hands him the phone and walks out.
Hello.
Hey bro. I don't have a lot of time so I'm going to make this real simple. I need your help. I need the best singer in the world.
Sorry ... I'm busy.
Brennan, it's okay if you're scared. I'm scared too.

I'm not scared! And besides, don't you remember what that guy yelled at me at the restaurant with Mom and Dad? I suck! So leave me alone! Brennan hangs up the phone, turns up the Cure and instantly starts crying. Come on everyone! That's it! Huh­ huh! Come on everyone! My name's Gavin! Come on everyone! Dale's Manager Randy comes up to him.
Hey Randy. It's going pretty good, huh?
You know what, you've got a real problem with your band. Food and wine is not bad, but this band blows. The organ player won't stop saying, "Come on everyone".
Come on everyone! Let's go!
I don't think it's that big a deal. At that moment Derek walks up.
What the fuck's wrong with the music?! That guy won't stop saying, "Come on everyone"! I got clients leaving the wine mixer, left and right.
DEREK (cont'd) If you don't fix this in the next ten seconds, you're fired Dale! 117. Dale runs over to the singer. People are starting to leave.
Hey where's everyone going? Come on everybody!
Hey! Can you stop saying, "Come on everybody"! People are starting to leave.
No can do. People like to be included in on the journey. Besides it's my signature move. Randy pulls the plug on the band and steps on the stage.
I'm sorry everyone, we're having some technical difficulties with the music! We're going to fix it right away!
Come on man! Derek shows up and gets in Dale's face.
I knew we shouldn't have give you this responsibility. You're just a big baby! I knew we shouldn't have hired you!
It's the fuckin' Catalina Wine Mixer!
It doesn't seem that bad. Let me go find a boom box or something.
(mocking) "Let me go find a boom box or something"! No! It's done! You've screwed up the Catalina Wine Mixer! I don't hear any music, you're fired!! We now hear Brennan's voice o.c.
TURNAROUND, EVERY NOW AND THEN I GET A LITTLE BIT LONELY AND YOU'RE
We see Brennan in a billowing white cotton shirt, black leather pants, neatly trimmed five o'clock shadow and 118. sandals. We've never seen him like this before, he looks good and is very confident.
TURNAROUND, EVERY NOW AND THEN I GET A LITTLE BIT TIRED OF LISTENING
What the hell is he doing?
He's singing. And it's beautiful! Brennan is walking through the crowd, he strokes a woman's cheek.
EVERY NOW AND THEN I FALL APART Drums kick in and we see that Dale is playing. People are filing back in.
I NEED YOU NOW TONIGHT AND I NEED
Rest of the band starts to kick in.
AND IF YOU ONLY HOLD ME TIGHT WE'LL
TOGETHER WE CAN TAKE IT TO THE END OF THE LINE YOUR LOVE IS LIKE A
All OF THE TIME
I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO AND I'M ALWAYS IN THE DARK WE'RE LIVING IN A POWDER KEG AND GIVING OFF SPARKS
I REALLY NEED YOU TONIGHT FOREVER'S GONNA START TONIGHT FOREVER'S GONNA
119. Dale steps out from the drums to the front of stage with Brennan.
ONCE UPON A TIME I WAS FALLING IN LOVE BUT NOW I'M ONLY FALLING APART THERE'S NOTHING I CAN DO A TOTAL
ONCE UPON A TIME THERE WAS LIGHT IN MY LIFE BUT NOW THERE'S ONLY LOVE IN THE DARK NOTHING I CAN SAY A
Brennan finishes with an insane note that is either great or awful, depending on your upbringing.

Dale hugs Brennan. We see that everyone has returned to the wine mixer, including hotel staff and extra boats have pulled up to the water's edge. A guy with a Raytheon name tag starts applauding. Then another from GE, Bechtel, Northrup, Carlysle Group, etc. all start applauding.
You saved me!
No brother, we saved us!
Encore! More! That was fantastic!
Come on everyone! Derek hops up on stage.
You did good Dale. People are leasing helicopters like crazy.
Thanks but what about Brennan?
Dale don't-
What about him? One song doesn't make up for forty years of being a freak.
You know what? I've been wanting to do this since I started working for you. 120. He winds up to punch him but instead Brennan punches him really hard in the a=.
Ow! That hurt. You used the knuckle! Get out of here! Both of you! Dale and Brennan walk away.
That felt good but I wish we could have made him lick white dog crap. Denise walks up to Brennan.
That was the bravest thing I have ever seen.
Denise? I can't believe you came. * * * * * *
I figured I'd hide in the back of the crowd in case you did something fucked up. But that was ... that was great. She kisses him lightly on the lips.
I hate to be rude but my Step Bro and I need some time.
I completely understand. I'll call you later. That really means a lot to me what you did out there. I know that couldn't have been easy for you. Do you mind me asking? What made you do it?

I was just laying in our room and I looked at your empty bed, and I thought if you can't break out and take a risk for your stepbrother, then who can you take a risk for? A DECK HAND, 25, calls out at them.
Guys!! You can be out there. That section is off limits for the general public! Don't want to have to say it again! Dale and Brennan both give him a thumbs up and keep talking.
What do we do now? You've lost your job. * * * * * * * * * * * *
Doesn't matter. What happened today was special. We've both taken important steps.

You know it's true. I feel like I can do anything! In fact, I was thinking, you know how it's a huge pain to make dinner reservations? What if we created a service, where people call us and tell us what time they want to have dinner and how many are in their party, and we take it from there?
But isn't that exactly what you do when you make a dinner reservation yourself?
No, think about it. You're leaving out some steps, that we would eliminate- 122. The boat hits a huge wave and pitched both guys overboard.
Aawwww! ! The boat hits a siren and starts to turn around.
I told you guys no less than three times that you were not supposed to be standing out there!
You absolutely did and we did not listen and we are sorry for it.
I tell you this much, you are lucky to be alive. They sit there shivering, sipping their coffee.
Can I ask you something? And you can be honest. I don't care anymore. But did you touch my drum set when you first moved in?

Honestly? No. I did not. 123. So our hover craft is cutting across the Everglades. And I'm there with former NFL coach, Jimmy Johnson, Geraldo Rivera, and Tia Carrera, and all of a sudden we look ahead-
Yeah, yeah that's great Derek. You know what happened to us yesterday? A bank robbery!
Oooo!!! Tell us about that, uncle Dale!!
Wow. That sounds exciting Dale!
Well it was pretty intense. But we got in there and it turns out it was a false alarm, but I did get to draw my gun. I told someone to freeze ... who later turned out to work at the bank.
Wow! That's so cool.
What about you Brennan? We're so excited about your engagement party!
I know Nancy, I got your five messages yesterday.
If you need help with anything, don't hesitate to call.
Well I have some other news. You all know how I flew out to St. Louis for the American Idol audition and it turned out I was way too old. And some guys took my luggage and things got really scary.
Sure we remember, it got real hairy out there. Those guys called themselves the St. Lunatics had circled you, brandishing box cutters?

Well do you remember the guy who saved me? The guy who stepped into the alley and said, "Hey leave him alone! He's part of my dogpound!" That man was Randy Jackson and we got to talking. And I sang for him, which he asked me not to do, but I did anyway. I don't know if you remember a group called the Thompson Twins. They were gigantic. I mean bigger than the Beatles.
124. * BRENNAN (cont'd) They might be doing a cruise ship tour and there is a chance that I could sing backup for them. Everyone applauds.
That's outstanding!
Brennan I knew it! I knew it!
Thompson Twins are pretty cool. Maybe we'll look into going on that cruise. 125. We start to pull out on the scene as everyone talks and eats and laughs.
This chair is really bad for my back. Dale can you help me get another one?
Uh yeah, sure.

from BROWNVM.BROWN.EDU (NJE origin LISTSERV@BROWNVM) by BROWNVM.BROWN.EDU (LMail V1.2a/1.8a) with BSMTP id 3108; Mon, 2 Jan 1995 02:00:50 -0500
Father of Mei and Satsuki, researcher at a university in
Mother of Mei and Satsuki, sick in the hospital
Caretaker of the house they have just moved into
The Cat bus, a friend of TOTORO
Is someone there from this house? Oh, thanks. I'm Kusakabe.
Father, it's beautiful! A tunnel of trees. Ah, that house?
It'll fall down. It'll fall down.
Hey, hey. We've got to open up the storm shutters.
There are acorns in the room.
Huh...I wonder if there are squirrels here?
Ah, just a minute. I'll open up over here.
Satsuki, would you open the back door?
You should be able to find it.
I don't know. Not cockroaches, not mice... Black. There were a whole
It must be "Mak-kuro Kurosuke". (A play on the word black (kuro).
Mak-kuro Kurosuke? Like the ones in the picture book?
It must be...Ghosts wouldn't be out on a beautiful day like this. When
COME ON OUT! IF YOU DON'T,
Okay, back to work. Where are the stairs to the second floor? Let's
Mei, I found it.....It's pitch black.
Mister Mak-kuro Kurosuke, are you here?
Father, there's something in this house after all!
That's great! Since I was a boy, I've wanted to live in a haunted
This is the neighbor-lady who watches over this house. She came to help
I'm Satsuki and this is my sister, Mei. How do you do?
How do you do? What nice children. If there had been time I could
We're so busy in the fields right now, but I cleaned a little, every
Mei, your hands are black! What happened?
Oh, Mei, your feet...Oh, mine are black too!
Oh, Oh. It looks like the 'susu-atari' have come out. (Soot balls of
Susu-atari? Are susu-atari like this, and move like this?
Yes, they live in old, empty houses and make dust here and there. I
Nothing that scary. If you're good, they won't do anything bad. Then
But what would you do if they came out at once?
Okay then. I won't go with you to the toilet at night.
Hee-hee. Say, would you go to the creek and bring up some water?
Keep pumping, until the water runs cold.
Oh, it's you. What can I do for you?
Ha, ha, ha! Reminds me of when I was a boy.
I hate boys! But I love Granny's o-hagi (sweet rice cake).
Thank you for all your help.
Father, this old house will fall down.
Ha, ha! What a problem, since we just moved in.
HA HA HA HA HA! Everyone laugh! So your fears will all run away. HA HA
Mei not scared, Mei not scared.
One, two, one, two, one, two...
Keep it up, keep it up.
To the hospital to visit mother!
That's nice! Say hello for me!
Mei, it's good to see you!
I'm so happy you all came. How's the new house? Are you settled in?
Mother, do you like haunted houses?
Of course. I've got to hurry and get well. I'd like to meet a ghost.
That's good. Right, Mei? We were worried. If you were scared, we
You're good at it. Isn't that nice, Mei?
Uh-huh, but Sis gets real mad.
That's because you never stay still.
Satsuki, come here. Isn't it too short? (Brushing Satsuki's hair)
Unruly, just like always, isn't it. Exactly like mine when I was your
When I grow up, will my hair be just like Mother's?
Probably, since you're just like I used to be.
Yes. The doctor was saying she'll be able to leave the hospital soon.
Tomorrow is probably too soon, though.
Mother says she wants to sleep together with Mei again.
But you're a big girl now. Weren't you going to sleep by yourself?
Starting today, I'm taking lunch (to school).
Her name is Mit-chan. Gochiso-sama. (Expression used daily after
Father, does Mei look like Sis?
Yes. Where are you going with your lunch basket?
Father, is it time for lunch?
Welcome. Oh, is it that time already?
Where's Mei? I'm going over to Mit-chan's house.
We haven't had lunch yet. Isn't she playing in the garden?
Mei, Mei!! ....MEI! Wake up! You can't sleep in a place like this!
Totoro? You mean Tororo that was in the picture book? (The character
Uh-huh. He said he was Totoro. With fur, and a mouth like this. One like
There you are, there you are. Hey, how great. Just like a secret
Father! Mei, says she met Totoro here.
Uh-uh. Before he was by a big tree.
But there was only one pathway...
Mei, let's go home. I said, Mei!
It's true! There really was Totoro! Not a lie.
Uh, Father and Satsuki don't think you're a liar. You must have
Tsukamori! (The shrine for the gods of the forest.) Let's go!
Father, that camphor tree. Isn't it huge?
She says the hole is gone.
Well, you can't see him all the time.
We'll see him again? I want to meet him too.
Well, if good fortune is with you. Isn't this a beautiful tree? It's
Oh yeah. I was supposed to go to Mit-chan's.
(To the gods of the forest) Thank you for taking care of Mei. From
(Drops hat and turns around to pick it up) Wait!
Today I have wonderful news. Mei met the spirit, Totoro. I'm thinking
Kanta! If you don't hurry, you'll be late!
Well, she says she wants to go where you are, and she won't listen.
But Mei, today's Father's day at the university and you promised
She was a good girl all day, right?
Sigh.....Granny, I'll go and speak with the teacher.
Satsuki's mother is in the hospital and it's rather difficult right
Shhhhh. You have to be quiet.
Tell them I'm going to skip the club today.
Okay, I'll tell the teacher. See you later.
Mei, let's hurry! It looks like rain.
Mei won't cry. Is she a big girl?
Please let us share your roof for a little while.
Mei go to meet him too.
And that's why I forgot it!
(Kanta's Mother) What dummy would forget his umbrella when it's raining?
You were probably swinging it around and broke it.
Oh, Satsuki. And little Mei, too. Granny!
Thank you for today (taking care of Mei).
Oh, Kanta lent us his umbrella.
Really? That kid? It's such a beat up old umbrella.
Mei was with me, so it really saved us. But Kanta got all wet. Thank
That's all right. He's always so dirty anyway; he must have gotten a
Are you getting on? All right, driver.
It'll be the next bus for sure. Does Mei want to wait at Granny's
Mei, are you sleepy? That's why I told you...Want to go to Granny's
Totoro?......Ah, just a minute. I'll lend you this...Hurry, Mei will
The train was late and I missed the bus. Were you worried?
It came! Father, it came! It came!
A cat, a cat bus! Really huge! With eyes like this!
Mother, it feels like my heart is still racing. It was a fantastic,
Okay, okay. I'm going to turn it off.
Father, I wonder if they'll come up tommorrow?
I wonder. Totoro would probably know. Good night.
Mei, that's where we planted the seeds.
Hooray! We did it, we did it!
We did it, we did it! It was a dream but it wasn't a dream!
Mr. Kusakabe, telegram. Mr. Kusakabe, it's a telegram. Nobody
Over here. This one's ready to eat.
Granny's garden is like a treasure-hill.
Say, let's take a little rest....They're nice and cold.
Is it? They've gotten a lot of Mr. Sun, so they're also good
Of course. If you eat Granny's vegetables, you'll get real healthy
So she's finally leaving the hospital.
Un-uh. It's not for good. She'll return to the hospital on Monday.
Is that right? Then we're going to have to get her to eat more and
The corn Mei picked, Mei will give to Mother.
That will make her so happy.
A telegram. Nobody was home so we accepted it for you.
For our house? Granny, Father won't be home until evening.
Open it. It might be an emergency.
Calm down, calm down. Do you know where your father is?
I know the telephone number of the research department, but we
Kanta, take her to your uncle's. Let her use the phone. Mei, you
Hello, long distance please. Tokyo 31-1382. Yes.
Hello, yes....Hello, is this the Archaeology Research
Yes, what is it? Uh-huh...from the hospital? I understand. I'll call
Did something happen with Mother? What shall I do? Father?
Don't worry. As soon as I find out what it's all about, I'll
Ma'am, may I wait here? Father will call back.
No way! This corn is for Mother. I said, no way! I'm giving this to
It seems Mother's not feeling well, so they're delaying her home
It can't be helped. If she rushes it and gets worse, what'll we do?
Then it's all right if Mother dies, is that right?
You dummy! I'm not talking to you anymore!
Let's put away the laundry. Don't be so sad. Granny's come to help, so
It was just like this last time. Just a short stay at the hospital.
It's okay, it's okay. Who would die and leave such nice children? Don't
You didn't see her at the bus stop?
Funny, where could she have gone?
A little while ago, we had a fight. Because Mei's a ...That kid. I
The Shichikokuyama Hospital? It would take even an adult at least
Kanta! Hurry and call your father! Mei's disappeared!
Darn Mei! She's always getting lost.
Excuse me, Mister. Did a little girl pass by on this road? My
Hmmmm...a little girl? I would remember if I saw someone...
I wonder if it was another road?
Are you sure she came this way?
I'm looking for my little sister. Did you see a little girl?
I think she's on her way to the Shichikokuyama Hospital. Four
Uh-uh. We came from Shichikokuyama, but we didn't see anyone like that.
No. How about you? Right now Dad and the others are searching. I'll
Mei tried to get to the hospital and got lost on the way. I'm sure.
A while ago, they found a sandal in the pond.
We don't know for sure if it belongs to Mei!
Nami Amida Buddha, Nami Amida Buddha... (a Buddhist chant)
The mud's deeper over there! Try there first!
(Showing her the sandal) This...this is it.
Thank heaven. I thought for sure it was Mei's.
We'll have to start over again.
We'll have to hurry. It'll be dark soon.
Let's divide up and search some more.
Please let me through to Totoro's den. Mei's lost. It'll be dark
Totoro! Totoro! Mei's lost! I've searched all over, but I can't
(yelling from the road as they pass) Mei-chan!
The trees are leaning out of the way!
You wanted to bring that corn to Mother?
You'll take us to the hospital? Thank you!
I'm sorry. It's just a little cold and the hospital had to go and
Well, the kids will be relieved when they hear. We've all come this
Those kids have to put up with so much. Satsuki's such a sensitive
When I get home I plan to really spoil them.
Ah, I've got to hurry and get well.
(looking out the window) Just now, in the pine tree, I thought
(picking up a piece of corn from the window) It could be. Look!
